description:
Applicants are required to be currently enrolled in a University/College for this internship opportunity.  

Job Purpose:

The Outside/Inside Plant Engineering Intern will provide support to the Network Development Team. The role will involve drafting schematic, electrical and scale drawings for engineer job plans and specifications. Duties may also include updating databases, developing and updating provisioning sheets, and site walks with an HT engineer to validate poles, pull boxes, utility holes, and addresses. Frequent interaction with Planning and Engineering is required to coordinate related work activities. Performs other related, marginal duties associated with engineering as needed.

Essential Functions

  • Assist Engineers with projects while learning the workflow process of day to day engineering. Perform all aspects of technical deployment projects, including an implementation plan, methods of procedures, additional technical resource identification, and execution of work. 50%
  • Develop/modify provisioning sheets, graphs, and charts as required. 10%
  • Assist engineers with reviewing plans, tracking permit submittals, assisting with administrative functions of engineering.10%
  • Update various databases and systems.10%
  • Interact and communicate with planners and engineers when necessary to determine work requirements.10%
  • Perform other related marginal duties as required.10%

Qualifications

  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Have a valid driver's license
  • Must be enrolled in an Associate's, Bachelor's or Master's degree program in CAD Drafting and Design, Engineering Technology, Computer Science, or Information Sciences with a technical concentration from a two-year college or university.
  • Completion of any one or combination of the following: drafter or architectural, mechanical, or similar drafting courses.
  • Knowledge of TCP/IP and MPLS Networks
  • Microsoft Office Suite: Familiar with all applications from the Microsoft Office Suite to create reports, analyze data, and present information.
  • Ability to learn to utilize new software applications with little/no training and documentation essential.
  • Microsoft Office
  • Ability to quickly learn and utilize new technologies/programming skills
  • 2 or more of the following college course equivalents: UH written communication (FW), UH focus requirement (O, OC), social sciences (DS), or any equivalent
  • Undergraduate students in the following disciplines (major or minor) are preferred: Business Administration, Engineering (any), Computer Science, Communication and Information Sciences, Communicationsï»¿
  • Minimum GPA: 3.0/4.0

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong desire to learn about programming and technology
  • General working knowledge of and interest in technology
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience with programming
  • Work completed toward pursuing a degree in computer science, information technology, information systems or a similar field
  • Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite

Job Summary

The Software Engineer Intern makes a meaningful impact on large-scale projects while building and refining their coding style. As a valued member of our team, they work closely with team members to help solve new and novel technical issues while building technical, communication and project management skills.

Responsibilities

  • Assist with building and deploying support to internal clients through instant messages, phone and face-to-face interactions
  • Collaborate with engineers, developers, architects, quality assurance, system engineers and product managers to solve new and existing technical issues
  • Understand requirements, implement designs, and provide administration tools and documentation for specific projects
  • Develop and maintain software to support business functions
  • Participate in design and code reviews
  • Follow and enhance existing development processes
  • Measure and verify that codes have acceptable performance and scalability

Who We Are

Rock Central is recruiting for 20+ businesses in the Rock Family of Companies for summer 2021 internships. Interns can expect to gain hands-on experience, learn how it feels to be in the workplace, participate in professional development opportunities and become a valuable member of a team.

Disclaimer 

This is an outline of the primary responsibilities of this position. As with everything in life, things change. The tasks and responsibilities can be changed, added to, removed, amended, deleted and modified at any time by the leadership group.

#LI-MM

IMPORTANT NOTICE:
Infineon Technologies takes data privacy and identity theft very seriously. As such, we do not request personally-identifiable information (PII) from applicants over the internet or electronically. Please kindly refrain from disclosing your PII electronically during the application process or to unauthorized websites that may purport to be Infineon or any of our affiliates.

In your new role you will:

  • Support Engineering Staff for DC-DC converter for Space and non-space products.
  • Support production by troubleshooting DC-DC Converters, supporting functional tests.
  • Support the release of design packages and review customer specification datasheets.
  • Troubleshoot/validate test fixtures.
  • Review schematic and assembly drawings
  • Perform setup and operate various test equipment in engineering laboratory.
  • Support failure analysis / reports.
  • Conduct processing of Engineering Change Order (ECO)

You are best equipped for this task if you have:

  • A Bachelors (2 years of course work completed) in Embedded System, Electrical, Electronics or Computer Science.
  • General knowledge of Electronic technologies
  • Understanding of electronic engineering principles in areas including analog and digital circuits, power supplies, and DC-DC converters.
  • Experience in PCB schematic and PCB layout.
  • Basic programming experience is a plus.
  • Hands-on experience performing bench electrical measurements using signal generators, DVMs, oscilloscopes and spectrum analyzers.
  • Good writing, analytical and problem-solving skills
  • The ability to follow oral and written instructions
  • Excellent communication skills and able to interact with multiple different stakeholders.
  • Current GPA of 3+



Infineon Power & Sensor Systems (PSS) semiconductors play a vital role in enabling intelligent power management, smart sensitivity as well as fast and reliable data processing in an increasingly digitalized world. IR HiRel, part of Infineon PSS, is a leader in high-reliability, rad hard power management and RF solutions for space and other extreme environments.


Our leading-edge power devices make chargers, adapters, power sources and lighting systems smarter, smaller, lighter and more energy-efficient. Our trusted sensors increase the context sensitivity of "things" and systems such as HMI, and our RF chips power fast and reliable data communication.

- We drive leading-edge power management, sensing and data transfer capabilities -

#LI-EZ1

US Job Description

 

Firm Information

Reed Smith is a global relationship law firm with more than 1,700 lawyers in 30 offices throughout the United States, Europe, Asia and the Middle East.

Founded in 1877, the firm represents leading international businesses, from Fortune 100 corporations to mid-market and emerging enterprises. Its lawyers provide litigation and other dispute resolution services in multi-jurisdictional and other high-stakes matters; deliver regulatory counsel; and execute the full range of strategic domestic and cross-border transactions. Reed Smith is a preeminent advisor to industries including financial services, life sciences, health care, advertising, entertainment and media, shipping and transport, energy and natural resources, real estate, manufacturing, technology, and education. For more information, visit reedsmith.com.

Position Summary

The Data Intelligence and Analytics Intern works directly with the HR Legal Recruiting and IT staff under the direction of the Director of Legal Recruiting. The position supports our HR and Legal Recruting teams with insights gained from analyzing recruiting, financial, HR, and other data sources. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for process optimization and novel solutions. Duties will also include using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. We expect strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. The developer must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. We expect the candidate to have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes. Skills with SQL, NoSQL, Python, R, and MATLAB are strongly preferred as well as skills in web and software development (HTML5, Java, C#).

Essential Functions

The Data Intelligence and Analytics Intern must have strong problem solving. Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets is required. Experience working with and creating data architectures. Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications. Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams. A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. The Data Intelligence and Analytics Intern will mainly:

  • Works with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging available data to assiste stakeholds when making complex business decsions.
  • Mines and analyzes data to drive optimization and improvement of business processes and strategies.
  • Assesses the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
  • Develops custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
  • Uses predictive modeling to increase and optimize client experiences, revenue generation, and other business outcomes.
  • Coordinates with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
  • Develops processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.

 

Requirements

Education: Masterâs degree or equivalent in computer science or relevant field of study.  Background in Statistics preferred

Experience: Preferably, experience within a law firm environment.

Skills: Skills with SQL, NoSQL, Python, R, and MATLAB are strongly preferred as well as skills with a enterprise BI platform (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, etc.)

 

Other

Supervisory Responsibilities: None

Equipment To Be Used:  Personal computer and other office equipment such as telephone, calculator, fax, machine, copier, scanner, etc.

Typical Physical Demands: Manual dexterity sufficient to operate standard office equipment.

Typical Mental Demands: Able to deal with stress associated with fast-paced work environment.  Multiple priorities/tasks.  Make judgment decisions and adapt to changing work situations.  Grasp and apply new ideas.  Communicate with various personalities at all levels.

Working Conditions: Works in typical office setting.  Occasionally called upon to work hours in excess of your normal daily schedule.

Reed Smith offers a challenging work environment, business casual dress code and a total compensation package that includes a competitive salary, flexible benefits program, tuition assistance, and generous 401 (k) plan.

As a firm, we adhere to and promote equal employment opportunity for all.

Reed Smith provides reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities, including in the application and interview process.

Qualified candidates only.  No search firms.

PI138437054

TITLE:                            Senior Data Scientist/Engineer

 

COMPANY:                    AMI Group, LLC

 

REPORTS TO:               Chief Executive Officer

 

SALARY RANGE:        $120,000 - $140,000

 

JOB SUMMARY

 

Primarily responsible for providing data science support for various projects within Chicago Parking Meters, LLC (âCPMâ).  The Senior Data Scientist assists in overseeing the activities of the data analyst(s) and provides advanced expertise and guidance on statistical and mathematical concepts for the data and analytics team. The Senior Data Scientist applies and inspires the adoption of advanced data science and analytics across the business.

The Senior Data Scientist synthesizes and leverages CPMâs data to enhance the businessâ capabilities for overall goal achievement. The Senior Data Scientist is instrumental in helping the business continue its evolution into an analytical and data-driven culture.

This role of the Senior Data Scientist supports relevant stakeholders through quantitative analytics, and the application of appropriate advanced analytics for CPMâs key initiatives.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES

 

  1. Provide advanced analysis, recommendations, and support for various projects within CPM. Projects include the rollout and ongoing performance measurement for CPMâs parking meter system and process improvements. The position will support and contribute to the success of these projects, including one or more of the following functions:

 

  1. Collect and manage project data, organize, analyze, and prepare reports on vendor and system performance.
  2. Develop statistical models in key areas of parking data including enforcement and demand.
  3. Assist in identifying and measuring Key Performance Indicators in numerous operational areas.
  4. Develop an understanding of the parking meter system requirements and project goals. Drawing upon this understanding and the collected project data, investigate options, draw conclusions and/or make recommendations as required.

 

  1. Manage the collection of meter data, which is supplied through the operator and meter equipment software and provide analysis of this data. As required, provide input and recommendations for leveraging this data to drive improved asset performance.

 

  1. Develop and support profitability analyses and models, including potential revenue, projected cost-savings, and operating efficiency maximization models. Recommend and develop automated processes for collecting data and managing output for these models. Participate in the development of industry leading work process, technology, revenue collection, and profitability analysis initiatives. 

 

  1. Implement and handle end-to-end data science products and analytics.

 

  1. Manipulate and extract âbig dataâ from large, disconnected datasets that can require complex queries and advanced knowledge of SQL with familiarity in a variety of databases.

 

  1. Work closely with team members and assist in developing the technical, statistical, and analytical skillsets of the data analyst(s). Direct and review the work of data analyst(s) and intern(s) to complete projects as required.

 

 


SKILLS, EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

 

At least five years of data science experience, preferably working as a Senior Data Scientist and/or Data Engineer.  The candidate must also have had substantial experience working on strategy or full-life cycle data science as well as experience working with data mining tools such as Python, SQL and R. A suitable candidate for this position will also have had experience in data mining and predictive modeling including linear and non-linear regression, logistic regression, and time series analysis models. Statistical machine learning experience is preferred.   The candidate will also have had experience working with deep learning algorithms and large datasets as well as experience working with unstructured data and experience cleaning and manipulating data.

The Senior Data Scientist should have at least a bachelorâs degree in Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or any other related quantitative field.  A masterâs degree in a similar analytical field is preferred. 

 

The candidate must have the ability to organize and prioritize work, and to interpret and present information clearly and professionally.  Must be proactive, meet assigned deadlines, be able to work both independently and as part of a team, must have a strong ability to mobilize people and work with both internal and external contacts.

 

 


All applicants will be afforded equal opportunity without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identification, marital status, national origin or ancestry, age, physical or mental handicap unrelated to ability, or an unfavorable discharge from military service.

 

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

At BBN Technologies, a subsidiary of Raytheon Technologies, we invent new science by applying cross-discipline techniques to tangible prototype systems to prove concept viability. Our Networking and Communications Technologies group anticipates the future in very large and very small scale information exchange across wired, wireless, and undersea environments.

We are seeking qualified and eager Graduate student a to join our team as a Fall 2021 Co-Op. You will join a project team that is designing, analyzing, and prototyping innovative data networking architectures. You will contribute to creating new algorithms and paradigms in such diverse and critical areas as network infrastructure security, network understanding, energy conservation, content networking, mobility, efficient channel access, and networking. You will learn strategies for both free-form thinking and disciplined application. You will hone your oral and written presentation skills. You will work with extraordinarily skilled team members, from project leadership to fellow interns.

What will you need?

  • Deep and dynamic curiosity
  • Understanding of Machine Learning and/or Math and/or Python
  • Experience in design, simulation, analysis, and/or implementation
  • Experience programming in modern languages
  • Available to work 40 hours per week, Fall 2021
Additional Skills that would be AWESOME / BENEFICIAL!
  • Experience with programming languages such as C, C++, or MATLAB
  • Experience with scripting languages (Perl, Python, etc.)
  • Experience with network simulation tools (ns2, ns3, or commercial tools)
  • Experience with signal processing fundamentals
  • Experience in a Linux environment
  • Experience with embedded system development
  • Ability to work in teams
  • Excellent written and verbal communications

Intern Supervision is provided by clinic to meet your BBS requirements

YOU MUST APPLY ONLINE AT THE COUNTY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED FOR POSITION.   Mental Health Clinician I/II/III | Job Details tab | Career Pages (governmentjobs.com)

DEFINITION MHCI
Under general direction, to provide assessments, diagnoses, prognoses, counseling and psychotherapeutic treatment for Mental Health Department clients; to provide education, consultation services, and training for other staff, community agencies, and the public; and to do related work as required.

DEFINITION MHCII
This is the advanced-level professional Mental Health Clinician classification. Individuals that occupy the level-2 have completed the BBS requirements to possess the BBS licensed clinician credentials designation (LCSW, or LMFT). Incumbents have responsibility for independently providing a variety of mental health services for individuals and groups. Incumbents are required to develop case service plans, identify appropriate treatment methods, and use a variety of applied psychotherapeutic techniques.

DEFINITION MHCIII
Under general direction, to provide assessments, diagnoses, prognoses, counseling and psychotherapeutic treatment for Mental Health Department clients; to provide education, consultation services, and training for other staff, community agencies, and the public; and to do related work as required.


DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS MHCI
This is an entry level professional Mental Health Clinician classification and typically the individual that meets the qualifications for this position is an unlicensed clinician that meets the requirements to be and is registered with the State Board of Behavioral Sciences (BBS) as an Associate Clinical Social Worker (ACSW), or Associate Marriage and Family Therapist (AMFT). Individuals occupying the Mental Health Clinician -I of the classification series typically have not completed the BBS required number of clinical service delivery hours working under the supervision of an assigned Licensed Clinician as required by the BBS. A Mental Health Clinician -I completes clinical service delivery responsibilities under the supervision of a Licensed Clinician assigned by the department to provided unlicensed clinician supervision.
 
Individuals in this job classification series have responsibility for providing a variety of mental health services for individuals and groups. Such individuals are also required to develop case service plans, identify appropriate treatment methods, and use a variety of applied psychotherapeutic techniques.
 
Upon successful completion of State Board of Behavioral Sciences (BBS) licensing exams and the awarding of Licensed Clinical Social Worker or Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist designation, incumbents may be promoted to the Mental Health Clinician level II.


DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS MHCII
This is the advanced-level professional Mental Health Clinician classification. Individuals that occupy the level-2 have completed the BBS requirements to possess the BBS licensed clinician credentials designation (LCSW, or LMFT). Incumbents have responsibility for independently providing a variety of mental health services for individuals and groups. Incumbents are required to develop case service plans, identify appropriate treatment methods, and use a variety of applied psychotherapeutic techniques.

DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS MHCIII
This is an advanced journey-level professional providing mental health services as part of a multi-disciplinary team under general supervision. Increments in this classification demonstrate a greater skill and depth of the job knowledge in the assortments, and are able to independently perform most complex clinical and case management assignments. Individuals that occupy the level-III have possessed the BBS licensed clinician credentials designation (LCSW, or LMFT) for a minimum of one year. Incumbents have responsibility for independently providing a variety of mental health services for individuals and groups. Incumbents are required to develop case service plans, identify appropriate treatment methods, and use a variety of applied psychotherapeutic techniques. Demonstrates leadership within the multi-disciplinary team.  Incumbents in the Level -III classification series may be required and assigned to provide consultation for other Mental Health Clinicians in the Mental Health Clinicians at the level-I and II in the clinician series. Incumbents in the Level-3 classification series after hour's crisis response duty s may also be assigned to be a clinical consultant for other clinicians that may include being the clinical consult contact staff as needed, for other clinicians fulfilling after hours crisis response duty.  Incumbents in the Level-III classification series may also be assigned to fulfill after hours crisis response duty.


REPORTS TO 
Assistant Director of Behavioral Health, Director of Behavioral Health, Behavioral Health Clinical Supervisor or designee

CLASSIFICATIONS SUPERVISED MHCI
This is not a supervisory classification.

CLASSIFICATIONS SUPERVISED MHCII/III
May serve as lead clinician

TYPICAL PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Sit for extended periods; frequently stand and walk; normal manual dexterity and eye-hand coordination; lift and move objects weighing up to 25 lbs.; corrected hearing and vision to normal range; verbal communication; use of office equipment, including computer, telephone, calculator, copiers and FAX.

TYPICAL WORKING CONDITIONS 
Work is performed in an office, clinic, home, school, or community environments; work is performed with people who may exhibit unstable and potentially violent behavior; continuous contact with other staff and the public.

 

Examples of Duties / Knowledge & Skills

MHCI

(The following is used as a partial description and is not restrictive as to duties required.)
  • Meets with individuals, families, and groups in clinic, home, schools, and community
  • settings to develop client centered service plans;
  • Provides direction for client mental health and community activities;
  • Assists clients with understanding their problems and developing plans to resolve them;
  • Provides a variety of Mental Health counseling and therapy for clients and their families;
  • Works with clients' families to secure their cooperation in treatment programs;
  • Advises clients on available community resources and serves as a liaison with organizations and service agencies;
  • Makes referrals and other arrangements for client treatment and service, as necessary;
  • Serves as a consultant for other Mental Health staff; prepares and present progress reports on assigned cases;
  • Cooperates with professionals from other disciplines in the development of team and collaborative diagnoses and treatment programs;
  • Develops recommendations for discharge and follow-up treatment planning for clients and their families;
  • May be assigned administrative responsibilities, including scheduling and case assignments;
  • Performs crisis intervention;
  • Performs involuntary hospitalization assessments and arranges for hospitalization, if necessary, may serve as an expert witness in court cases;
  • Other duties as assigned.

  • Independently assess, evaluates, and provides mental health and/or substance abuse services including individual, group, and family therapy/counselling, rehabilitation, crises intervention, and case management services for persons with serious mental illnesses or youth with serious emotional disturbance utilizing culturally sensitive, client/family-centered, strength-based well ness and recovery models of service delivery.
  • Meets with individuals, families, and groups in clinic, home, schools, and community settings to develop client centered service plans;
  • Provides direction for client mental health and community activities;
  • Assists clients with understanding their problems and developing plans to resolve them;

  • Works with clients' families to secure their cooperation in treatment programs;
  • Advises clients on available community resources and serves as a liaison with organizations and service agencies;
  • Collaborates with other support agencies and community organizations.
  • Makes referrals and other arrangements for client treatment and service, as necessary;

  • Cooperates with professionals from other disciplines in the development of team and collaborative diagnoses and treatment programs;
  • Develops recommendations for discharge and follow-up treatment planning for clients and their families; may be assigned  administrative responsibilities, including scheduling and case assignments;
  • Assist in the development and monitoring of policies and procedures as assigned.
  • Performs crisis intervention;  
  • Performs involuntary hospitalization assessments and arranges for hospitalization, if necessary, may serve as an expert witness in court cases;
  • Develops and participates in training on a verity of topics such as cultural competency, clinical practice, compliance, treatments planning, case management and makes presentations to local agencies and community groups regarding issues related to mental health and or substance abuse.
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

Minimum qualifications & Requirements

Any combination of training and experience which would likely provide the required knowledge and abilities is qualifying. A typical way to obtain the required knowledge and abilities would be:

Special Requirements:

  • Possession of a license as a Licensed Clinical Social Worker or as a Marriage and Family Counselor issued by the State of California.
  • Possession of, or ability to obtain, an appropriate valid California Driver's License.


Mental Health Clinician I
Experience: Two years of professional experience working in mental health counseling, psychotherapy, and related social services in a public or certified private welfare or health agency.

AND

Education: Equivalent to a Master's degree in psychology, social work, marriage and family counseling, or a related field from an accredited college or university.


Mental Health Clinician II

Education: Equivalent to a Master's degree in psychology, social work, marriage and family counseling, or a related field from an accredited college or university.
 
AND
 
Experience:  One year as a Mental Health Clinician I with the County of San Benito.
 
OR
 
Three years of professional experience working in mental health counseling, psychotherapy, and related social services in a public or certified private welfare or health agency.

Mental Health Clinician III

Education: Equivalent to a Master's degree in psychology, social work, marriage and family counseling, or a related field from an accredited college or university.
 
AND

Experience:  One year as a Mental Health Clinician II with the County of San Benito.
 
OR
 
Three years of professional experience working in mental health counseling, psychotherapy, and related social services in a public or certified private welfare or health agency.

 

Supplemental information

MHCI
Knowledge of: 

  • Principles, techniques and trends in counseling, psychotherapy, and various treatment modalities.
  • Biological, behavioral and environmental aspects of emotional disturbances, mental disability, retardation, and substance abuse.
  • The scope and activities of public and private health and welfare agencies and other available community resources.
  • Identification of individual, social, and environmental problems and their analysis and resolution in existing social contexts.
  • Legislative and administrative rules and regulations pertaining to Lanterman-Petris-Short and Short-Doyle services.

Ability to:
  • Perform a variety of complex psychiatric social work and psychotherapy for Mental Health Department clients.
  • Develop clear and comprehensive case records and documentation.
  • Develop and maintain cooperative, constructive relationships with families of clients, members of other professional disciplines, social agencies, and other staff.
  • Prepare treatment plans, client treatment recommendations, and a variety of reports.
  • Organize and manage a caseload.
  • Define a therapist's role and deal with clients in a variety of circumstances and settings in accordance with professional standards and ethics.
  • Conceptualize and prioritize the problems of mentally disordered persons, determining their needs, services, and appropriate treatment methods.
  • Integrate a number of clinical approaches into a treatment plan.
  • Recognize a potential crisis and deliver crisis intervention services.
  • Handle stress and unstable client behavior.
  • Work with people from a diversity of ethnic and cultural backgrounds.

position: Veterans Preferred - Recruiter, Early Careers Recruiting
description:
Military Veterans are Encouraged to Apply.  
At Expedia Group, we believe travel is a force for good in the world. You don't have to look too closely to realize right now thatthe world needs all the goodness it can get. That means the work we do, powering global travel for everyone, everywhere, is more important now than ever.

On our Early Careers team, we are responsible for engaging, hiring and developing a diverse base of talent across Expedia Group, globally. This includes engaging women in high school to foster their computer science careers, hiring interns from a myriad of backgrounds and cultures across 3 continents and developing new grads and career changers as they begin their careers in tech. We are on a journey to transform how we empower early in career talent, thinking outside of the box and breaking down barriers on our way.

If you are excited about doing good through the power of travel and motivated by the impact you can make in the lives of early in career talent, then this is the team for you!

What You Will Do:


  • Own the end-to-end recruiting process for early careers portfolio withfocus on a defined business division and / or product focus (intern, grador apprentice) delivering on EC demand


  • Own relationships with EC attraction channels - campus, vendor,student group, non for profit,etcto ensure robust engagement andhealthy candidate pipeline


  • Plan and execute attraction / pipelining strategies, building scale forfuture roles with a focus on building I&D pipelinesthrough on campus and partner engagement and proactive sourcing.


  • Manage Campus Teams ofExpedianson campus, via interviews,etc.


  • Facilitate intake meetings, assessment centers, interview processeswith hiring managers to ensure alignment on identifying the mostsuccessful candidates in the talent pool


  • Facilitate intern conversion process to ensure ROI of internshipprogram is fully realized


  • Assess applicant/candidate quality, skills and fit to identify the bestcandidate for a position


  • Maintain effective relationships with candidates through therecruiting process including negotiating offers


  • Practice strong, influential communication skills while communicatinginternally and externally


  • Educate hiring managers on EC products and strategy as a SMEusing internal and external data / benchmarking


  • Act as an ambassador of Expedia Group, demonstrating andarticulating our values, culture, work environment, business strategiesand benefits


  • Work collaboratively, putting the goals of the team and business first,embodying Expedia Group's Mission, Purpose & Values


  • Champion Inclusion & Diversity at Expedia Group, challengingcolleagues and stakeholders to drive improved representation



Who You Are:


  • You are have demonstrated experience as a tenacious team player on your recruiting team who takes pride in hiring the best talent while persisting and being resilient through challenges, taking personal responsibility for searching out and resolving any blockers that you face.

Description
WebMD is the most recognized and trusted brand of health information and the leading provider of health information services, serving consumers, physicians, healthcare professionals, employers and health plans through our public and private online portals and WebMD the Magazine. The WebMD Health Network includes WebMD, Medscape, MedicineNet, eMedicine, RxList, theheart.org and Medscape Education. Our consumer portals and mobile health applications provide engaging, relevant and credible health and wellness information, personalized health assessment tools and access to online communities.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

WebMD's Data Management team is looking for a Data Engineer with a passion for data. You don't need to be a doctor to work the data at WebMD, but have to be able to diagnose and solve any data problems. Our data can predict and forecast the cold and flu season better than the CDC. We use
collaborative filtering on everything. If you visited us, you are probably in many look-alike models we have.

We support databases that can respond in milliseconds or aggregate billions of rows in seconds. We process 300G of data every day and support data warehouses, data lakes, data marts. We manage the data as well as the infrastructure that supports it.

This is your chance to use what you just learned in the real world. You probably coded in Java or Python, we use them. You probably stayed up all night trying to get neural network models to produce significant results, we use them. You probably had to write a Spark project that had to use all three RDD, DataFrames and DataSets. We use them.

This is NOT an intern role. We are interested in developing someone with a computer science degree or engineering degree that wants to pursue data engineering & development.

description:
As a PhD Applied Research Intern you will work closely with leading experts and apply real-world solutions that span across the areas of Machine Learning, Robotics, and Software Engineering. 
About the Work
Depending on your skill sets and areas of interest, your work will focus on some or all of the following below
Autonomy
Machine Learning Research and develop solutions for behavior prediction, intent understanding, planning using advanced sequence, graph neural networks based on supervised or reinforcement learning
Machine Learning Infrastructure Design scalable and optimizable systems that can process petabytes of data for model compilation & training in production
Perception Resolve real-world robotics problems in one or more of the following areas computer vision, sensor fusion, state estimation, object detection, classification, and tracking
Behavior Develop novel prediction & planning algorithms in domains like machine learning, trajectory optimization, reasoning under uncertainty, modeling system dynamics and reachability, and probabilistic reasoning.
Mapping & Localization Research, develop and implement algorithms to solve large-scale mapping and real-time localization problems for our fleet of self-driving delivery robots

About You

You are currently in a PhD program focusing in one or more of the following areas Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Robotics, Mathematics, or a closely related field

You will work with extraordinarily skilled team members, from project leadership to fellow interns.

Description: Our client is currently seeking a Market Research Manager

 
POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the general direction of the Vice President of Market Research, and in partnership with cross-functional internal partners, this hands-on role works primarily on Voice of the Customer primary market research and related analysis. This role requires significant coordination with cross-functional stakeholders. The role also coordinates the work of preferred partner vendors to augment the teamâs capacity and identifies when an elevated level of expertise is warranted to support project objectives. This role manages the CXI teamâs intern and may manage full time direct reports. The Market Manager will have an attention to detail and be a proactive, critical thinker who is interested and able to work in a matrixed, team-oriented organization where all team members take responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work while exemplifying AmerisourceBergenâs guiding principles. In addition, the market research manager works closely with a number of key roles, stakeholders and functions across the organization to include but not limited to the following: business stakeholders (sales), financial analysts, customer operations, customer solutions, distribution operations and marketing. S/he needs to be a creative thinker and propose innovative approaches to data collection and analyses. The market research manager should know statistical methods and internal data sets to complete research projects. In addition, the market research manager will understand and effectively employ a number of ways to visualize data in a way that is highly effective and persuasive. Finally, the market research manager must be inherently analytical and have a high level of curiosity in getting to next level understanding of insights behind the data. Excellent written and communications skills will also be a necessity for this role.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Â· Reviews research briefs to understand objectives and consults on the design of surveys to ensure the data collected will facilitate the right analysis to generate findings that support the objectives
Â· Independently programs and tests surveys, including the development of call to action and thank you messages, uploads respondent data, and deploys surveys
Â· Integrates data from outside sources into Qualtrics and utilizes Qualtrics analytical tools to develop findings
Â· Builds dashboards, provides training on optimal use, and continuously finds ways to improve data visualizations and incorporate new Qualtrics features within the dashboards
Â· Calculates required respondents to achieve desired confidence level. Checks and ensures data validity. Identifies when advanced analytical techniques are appropriate.
Â· Conducts analysis of Voice of the Customer data. Demonstrates strong proficiency with all Qualtrics analytical tools.
Â· Identifies and integrates secondary data sources into the VOC analysis in order to improve the specificity and actionability of the analysis, findings and recommendations.
Â· Demonstrates insightful quantitative understanding of a data set. Manipulates, analyzes and visualizes data to reveal trends in customer expectations and customer perceptions of AmerisourceBergenâs performance. Identifies correlations in the data, including value drivers. Elevates key opportunities where improvement will have the greatest impact.
Â· Actively participates with the CXI team in presentations and workshops where findings and recommendations to improve the CX are discussed and debated. Interprets VOC analysis and effectively communicates statistical concepts in way that makes it easy to understand and is not intimidating to non-technical audiences
Â· With the hands-on support of the Vice President of Market Research, and preferred partners, prepares findings reports for senior executives. Using Microsoft PowerPoint, develops reports with clear, compelling, and easy to interpret data visualizations along with a narrative that translates the data into insights that convey a story or distinct point of view.
Â· Becomes AmerisourceBergenâs foremost expert use of Qualtrics, a best-in-class technology for research and analysis. Continuously improves proficiency in utilizing all aspects of the tool, particularly those related to analysis. May support the training other associates. Stays current on knowledge of new features/functionality and proactively brings ideas for how these can be applied to support the teamâs goals
Â· Generates timely and concise communications appropriate for executive leadership to understand project status and pending issues.
Â· Monitors response rates to surveys and proactively makes recommendations on when additional action is required to accelerate participation
Â· Maintains a tracking program to report on budget allocated to donations in association with charitable giving for survey incentives
Â· Collaborates with IT, preferred vendors, and others to problem-solve through data integration requirements, survey deployment decisions, and other operational considerations related to the VOC and customer experience programs
Â· Manages the internâs workflow/priorities, reviews all work contributed by intern, and provides guidance and coaching to support the internâs professional development.
Â· Proactively recommends ideas to improving efficiency and quality in the teamâs workflows, processes, and deliverables
Â· Builds and maintains strong relationships across the organization through frequent and open communication/collaboration
Â· Proactively seeks out and manages time to accommodate for continuous learning and development.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Typical Education
Â· Minimum of bachelors (advanced degree (Masters or PHD preferred) in data analytics, marketing research, statistics or computer science or related field;
Â· Typically requires 3+ years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience.
Â· Solid knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
Â· Knowledge of one or more market research platforms (e.g. Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth, SPSS, Medallion)
Â· Proficiency in the use of statistical methodologies (regression, maxdiff, conjoint, Turf analysis, correlation, descriptive variables).
Â· Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics and multivariate testing
Â· Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Â· Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas.

Work Complexity
Â· Designs experiments, tests hypotheses and builds statistical models.
Â· Employs a number of complex research methodologies (correlation matrices, turf analysis, conjoint analysis, max diff)
Â· Highly skilled in running bivariate and simple multivariate statistics

Market Research
Â· Design, test and program surveys to support VOC programs and other insight projects
Â· Designs qualitative and quantitative studies and aligns them to the proper use case.
Â· Identifies audience size, sample size, confidence level and confidence interval necessary to meet statistical validation

Strategic Planning & Project Planning
Â· Participates in team strategic planning sessions to support annual and long-range objectives.
Â· Creates and manages research project plans and tracks key milestones

Business Requirements
Â· Works with commercial and functional stakeholders to define business problems and develop research methodologies to gather the necessary insights that inform recommendations
Â· Possesses a high-level understanding of one or more business or functional areas.
Â· Develops key business stakeholder relationships.
Â· Leverages knowledge of internal and external data sources and leverages this knowledge to solve business problems
Data Requirements
Â· Works with others to support data collection in support of research projects and integration of internal systems (e.g. Qualtrics with SFDC) to automate data transfer.
Â· Works to combine customer experience data (e.g. satisfaction) and operational data (e.g. financial) to complete robust analyses and findings.

Analytics
Â· Solves business analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies.
Â· Works in iterative processes with business stakeholders and validates findings.
Â· Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
Â· Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples.

Communications and Presentation
Â· Presents and depicts the rationale of findings in easy to understand terms for the business and functional groups.
Â· Highly effective visual depiction of data, trends, charts, graphs in compelling fashion.
Â· Communicates and works with stakeholders and other SMEâs as required to meet project objectives.

4. What special requirements/skills you would like us to screen for (i.e.: "Must Haves")? See job description as well.
Data analytics skill, statistical modeling skills should be advanced. Intermediate to advanced experience with statistical software (R, SPSS, Qualtrics, Sawtooth etc.)

JOB TITLE: Intern, Quality Assurance

LOCATION: San Diego, CA

The following statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. Management retains the discretion to add or change the duties at any time.

SUMMARY:

This is a Quality Assurance internship opportunity for a current full-time student seeking a technical Bachelor's degree. You will gain hands-on experience with assignments that familiarize yourself with the Quality Assurance function in the defense electronics industry. The Quality Engineering internship is offered to students in order to educate them on Quality Engineering related activities and provide the opportunity to see all or part of the total manufacturing quality cycle of buying and receiving material, manufacturing and inspecting WIP, internal Quality Systems and Processes, and customer delivery. In support of and under the direction of the Quality Manager, the intern will participate in activities associated with typical Quality roles and responsibilities. The San Diego facility products are designed and manufactured to protect our ships, aircraft, and most importantly, our country. Join the Cobham San Diego team and gain valuable knowledge and experience while helping protect the U.S.A and our allied forces around the world.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS and DUTIES may include:

Review/evaluate company metrics against company's Quality Policy
Participate in Corrective Action and Preventative Action (CAPA) investigations. Carry out actions as determined to be necessary. Perform effectiveness checks in support of the CAPA program and continuous improvement.
Participate in the formation and maintenance of standard work instructions, tools, and training materials.
Participate in designated continuous improvement projects.
Provide Quality Systems support.
Additional tasks and projects, as needed.

MINIMUM JOB QUALIFICATIONS: (The following qualifications can be acquired and demonstrated through experience, education and/or vocational training.)

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree with a minimum of two years of college level course work at an accredited four-year university with a major in Engineering, Computer Science, or Mathematics.
Minimum GPA of 3.0.
Strong Proficiency in Excel functions.
Role requires extensive use of spreadsheet applications.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Able to work effectively as a part of an integrated team.

SECURITY
Must meet the definition of a US person for ITAR requirements.

Founded in 1934 by aviation innovator Sir Alan Cobham, our values of Trust, Talent and Technology have driven us to become a global leader in state-of-the-art aerospace and defense systems. It's the insights of our innovators today that will secure our collective future. Innovators like you!

If you are authorized to work in the United States, then we encourage you to apply. We are unable to sponsor work visas.

Cobham is one of the world's leading companies engaged in the development, delivery and support of leading-edge aerospace and defense systems in the air, on land and at sea. Our clients and partners trust Cobham to deliver the mission-critical technology they need, and we trust our employees to draw on their ingenuity and passion to deliver those solutions. This leads to an empowering culture for our people. Our Leadership team is open, sharing plans for the next five years, driving retention by offering demanding, exciting work, and providing full guidance and mentoring.

Who we are!
At BBN Technologies, a subsidiary of Raytheon Technologies, we invent new science by applying cross-discipline techniques to tangible prototype systems to prove concept viability. Our Networking and Communications Technologies group anticipates the future in very large and very small scale information exchange across wired, wireless, and undersea environments.

We are seeking qualified and eager Graduate student a to join our team as a Fall 2021 Co-Op. You will join a project team that is designing, analyzing, and prototyping innovative data networking architectures. You will contribute to creating new algorithms and paradigms in such diverse and critical areas as network infrastructure security, network understanding, energy conservation, content networking, mobility, efficient channel access, and networking. You will learn strategies for both free-form thinking and disciplined application. You will hone your oral and written presentation skills. You will work with extraordinarily skilled team members, from project leadership to fellow interns.

  • Student pursuing a MasterÂs degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math or related technical field
  • Deep and dynamic curiosity
  • Understanding of Machine Learning and/or Math and/or Python
  • Experience in design, simulation, analysis, and/or implementation
  • Experience programming in modern languages
  • Available to work 40 hours per week, Fall 2021
Additional Skills that would be AWESOME / BENEFICIAL!
  • Experience with programming languages such as C, C++, or MATLAB
  • Experience with scripting languages (Perl, Python, etc.)
  • Experience with network simulation tools (ns2, ns3, or commercial tools)
  • Experience with signal processing fundamentals
  • Experience in a Linux environment
  • Experience with embedded system development
  • Ability to work in teams
  • Excellent written and verbal communications

description:
Description

Regional Medical Center of San Jose is a 264 bed acute care hospital with a Level II Trauma Center. The hospital provides a host of technologically advanced services including Cardiovascular, Neuro, Orthopedic, Bariatric and General Surgery, Interventional Pulmonology and services for Women. Regional holds Joint Commission advanced certification as a Comprehensive Stroke Center and a Get with the Guidelines- Stroke Gold Plus Performance Achievement Award from the American Heart Association/American Stroke Association. County-designated STEMI (heart attack) Receiving Center designated Lung Cancer Screening Center, a member of Extracorporeal Life Support Organization (ECMO) and certified by The Joint Commission in Sepsis care. 

 

 

Our Clinical Lab Scientist teams are a committed, caring group of colleagues. We have a passion for creating positive patient interactions. If you are dedicated to caring for the well-being of others, this could be your next opportunity. We want your knowledge and expertise! 

 

SCHEDULE: 0.8 (32 hours per week), SHIFT: Days with rotating weekends.

 

POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the direction of the Pathologists and Laboratory Managers, the Clinical Lab Scientist I performs, as assigned, all technical, analytical, clerical, and quality assurance tasks and duties associated with laboratory testing.

Qualifications

LICENSE/CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: California Dept. of Health Services CLS License


EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: Ability to multi-task and strong attention to detail. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.Good judgment, common sense.  Ability to assume initiative for prompt

and accurate performance of tests with appropriate documentation and notification of abnormal results.  Ability to work under routine and stressful conditions in an accurate and timely manner.           

Preferred: 6 months or more experience as Clinical Laboratory Scientist or Clinical Laboratory Scientist intern in a hospital setting.   ASCP-certified Medical Technologist.

 

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: 4-year College degree in Biological Sciences (BA or BS)

 

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:

Minimum:   Ability to read, write, and converse in English.  Strong organizational skills.  Advanced math and chemistry/biology knowledge. Practical and current knowledge in all

appropriate laboratory disciplines. Basic Phlebotomy skills. Basic computer skills.

Preferred:   Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel.

We offer you an excellent total compensation package, including competitive salary, excellent benefit package and growth opportunities. We believe in our team and your ability to do excellent work with us. Your benefits include 401k, PTO medical, dental, flex spending, life, disability, tuition reimbursement, employee discount program, employee stock purchase program and student loan repayment. We would love to talk to you about this fantastic opportunity.

Nearest Secondary Market: New York City

Overview:

St. Joseph Health Regional Hospital, now part of CommonSpirit Health formed by the alignment of Catholic Health Initiatives (CHI) and Dignity Health, is the highest-level major trauma center in the Brazos Valley. With the largest team of Speech Therapists in the region, we provide speech therapy to patients in our acute care hospitals, rural hospitals, and outpatient therapy clinics.

We currently have an immediate need for a Full Time Speech-Language Pathologist [SLP] to join our team in Bryan / College Station, TX.

Do you have a professional dream job? Join our team and make it a reality! With the large scope of service our SLP team is responsible for and our flexible approach to patient care, we can make your clinical setting, schedule, and/or specialization dreams come true! Do you have an area of specialization you want to develop? Join our team and let us support you in developing your specialized skills through formal mentoring and continuing education support!

As a member of our SLP team, you could serve patients in one of our multidisciplinary outpatient clinics or in our acute care hospitals. Want to work in more than one setting? You can do that too! No matter the setting, training and support is available from our team of well-rounded and experienced SLPs who work together to improve the lives of those with communication and swallowing disorders.

If you are a compassionate CCC-SLP who would like more information about this unique opportunity, connect with St. Joseph Health Regional Hospital today to experience what it is like to collaborate with talented rehabilitation professionals!

#missioncritical


Responsibilities


JOB SUMMARY

  • The Speech-Language Pathologist (SLP) is responsible for maintaining standards of professional and ethical practice following the guidelines of the State of Texas Board of Examiners for Speech-Language Pathology and Audiology. The SLP delivers quality therapy services to patients of all age groups by performing evaluations and developing individual treatment plans and goals to maximize functional outcomes. The SLP actively participates in discharge planning, implements the treatment program, and reassesses treatment results. Services are delivered within the framework of an interdisciplinary team approach, including significant others, and the patient. These services are delivered in compliance with St. Joseph Regional Rehabilitation Center's mission, ethical standards, and policies and procedures.



ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • ESSENTIAL
  • Establishes and demonstrates appropriate therapeutic procedures based upon goals set for patient and treatment disorder. Regulates rehabilitation guidelines for diet consistencies and swallow precautions.
  • Utilizes objective tests and measures appropriately for varying diagnoses. Establishes appropriate treatment plans and goals with specified time frames.
  • Maintains timely and accurate medical records. Records legibly in patient charts. Completes reports in an organized, thorough and timely manner. Completes all tasks requested by the Lead Speech-Language Pathologist in a timely manner.
  • Fosters communication with other therapists, physicians, nurses, volunteers, patients and families and other hospital personnel to establish department support. Attends and provides quality input to team conferences, departmental meetings and other hospital meetings.
  • Attends departmental and hospital in-services. Attends one seminar/conference annually.
  • Provides department specific orientation to new employees as instructed by the Lead Speech-Language Pathologist. Provides dysphagia education to new nursing employees through nursing orientation. Assists in teaching/training new/current rehabilitation techs/nursing assistants.
  • Completes all patient and family education. Provides information on outside resources to meet the patient's specific needs.

    • OTHER
    • Performs other duties as assigned to meet the organization`s needs.


    Qualifications


    QUALIFICATIONS

    • Education
      • Required: Master`s degree (e.g. MA, MS, MBA, MSN, MSW)
    • Major
      • Required: Communication Sciences and Disorders or Equivalent
    • Experience
      • Preferred: 2 years clinical experience
      • Required: CCC-SLP
    • Skills
      • Required: Basic computer and data entry skills
      • Preferred:
    • Licensure/Certifications
      • Required: Licensed by the State of Texas- Speech-Language Pathology/ Intern; eligibility to begin clinical fellowship period with ASHA membership upon completion (required); CPR certified
      • Preferred: Certificate of Clinical Competence; Member of the American Speech-Language Hearing Association (ASHA)

    chistjosephtherapy

    texasslp

    related skills: speech production, speech rhythm, speech fluency, stuttering, voice disorders, inappropriate pitch, harsh voice, cognitive communication impairments, attention impairments, memory loss, problem solving disorders, swallowing issues, feeding difficulties, vitalstim therapy, dysphagia, modified barium swallow studies, lee silverman voice treatment, lsvt loud, parkinson's disease, myofascial release, manual techniques, facial nerve palsy, feeding and oral aversion, autism spectrum disorders, cleft palate, resonance training, aerophagia, gerd program, pre-laryngectomy counseling, tdlr, cancer, swallowing rehabilitation

    #missioncritical

    ~LI-CHI

company: Regional Medical Center of San Jose
description:
Description

SHIFT: Days (rotating weekends)
SCHEDULE: Full-time


Regional Medical Center of San Jose is a 264 bed acute care hospital with a Level II Trauma Center. The hospital provides a host of technologically advanced services including Cardiovascular, Neuro, Orthopedic, Bariatric and General Surgery, Interventional Pulmonology and services for Women. Regional holds Joint Commission advanced certification as a Comprehensive Stroke Center and a Get with the Guidelines- Stroke Gold Plus Performance Achievement Award from the American Heart Association/American Stroke Association. County-designated STEMI (heart attack) Receiving Center designated Lung Cancer Screening Center, a member of Extracorporeal Life Support Organization (ECMO) and certified by The Joint Commission in Sepsis care. 

 

Our Clinical Lab Scientist teams are a committed, caring group of colleagues. We have a passion for creating positive patient interactions. If you are dedicated to caring for the well-being of others, this could be your next opportunity. We want your knowledge and expertise! 

 

SCHEDULE: 1.0 (40 hours per week), SHIFT: Days with rotating weekends.

 

POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the direction of the Pathologists and Laboratory Managers, the Clinical Lab Scientist I performs, as assigned, all technical, analytical, clerical, and quality assurance tasks and duties associated with laboratory testing.

Qualifications

LICENSE/CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: California Dept. of Health Services CLS License


EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: Ability to multi-task and strong attention to detail. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.Good judgment, common sense.  Ability to assume initiative for prompt

and accurate performance of tests with appropriate documentation and notification of abnormal results.  Ability to work under routine and stressful conditions in an accurate and timely manner.           

Preferred: 6 months or more experience as Clinical Laboratory Scientist or Clinical Laboratory Scientist intern in a hospital setting.   ASCP-certified Medical Technologist.

 

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: 4-year College degree in Biological Sciences (BA or BS)

 

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:

Minimum:   Ability to read, write, and converse in English.  Strong organizational skills.  Advanced math and chemistry/biology knowledge. Practical and current knowledge in all

appropriate laboratory disciplines. Basic Phlebotomy skills. Basic computer skills.

Preferred:   Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel.

We offer you an excellent total compensation package, including competitive salary, excellent benefit package and growth opportunities. We believe in our team and your ability to do excellent work with us. Your benefits include 401k, PTO medical, dental, flex spending, life, disability, tuition reimbursement, employee discount program, employee stock purchase program and student loan repayment. We would love to talk to you about this fantastic opportunity.

Hospital Corporation of America (HCA) is a community of 94,000 Registered Nurses and 38,000 active physicians. Description:

Summary: Provides administrative and clerical support for all study conduct activities according to Standard Operating Procedures and/or established practices under the guidance and supervision of Study Directors and Principle Investigators. Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. 1. Maintains knowledge of applicable APS Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) in order to successfully perform job duties, and GLP regulations as they apply to the preclinical research environment and individual protocols. 2. Assists in collection, documentation and analysis of pre-clinical data. 3. Assists in the coordination of study tasks from pre-study initiation to study completion. 4. Performs accurate and timely record keeping consistent with the maintenance of facility SOPs. Utilizes computer systems to enter and reference data as needed. 5. Assists in study planning and design of studies, under the direction and review of the scientific management team, to meet desired project endpoints, including coordinating prestudy meetings and data review. May act as Study Director on select projects under the direction and review of the scientific management team. 6. Responsible for study planning activities, assists with generating study protocols when directed, coordinates and monitors activities in support of study conduct. 7. Communicates effectively with Sponsors, Study Directors, Principal Investigators and Testing Facility Management on the progress of all studies. 8. Assists with data collection, database entry and generating/tabulating data. 9. Distributes study related documents, i.e. copies of study data sheets 10. Creates documentation per SOP to assist with test/control article accountability. 11. Ships specimens, documents, CDs, DVDs etc. per SOP, maintaining accurate chain of custody documentation. 12. Assists with generating technical reports as directed and assist in identifying issues and recommend solutions. 13. Maintains client inventory and is required to be familiar with internal and competitor products. 14. Types correspondence and various types of documentation in proper format and proofreads/distributes as assigned. 15. Completes special department projects and duties (i.e., data collection, report creation, information maintenance, contacting personnel for routine updates, etc.) as required to support daily business operations.

research project, Animal, research, preclinical, clinical, project management, sop, GLP, technical writing, biology, animal research

research project

Must Have: - 6 months lab experience (intern or school is ok) - Comfortable with animal research - 6+ months of under graduate research experience - Attention to detail and enthusiasm for research (verified by references) Nice to have: - Clinical animal research experience - Technical writing experience - Preclinical research experience

Entry Level

This 12+ month position starts ASAP.

This is a TEMPORARY INTERNSHIP POSITION at BD Biosciences. Candidates will be students from local universities who are pursuing an applicable degree. This position is expected to implement change, contribute new ideas, and find innovative methods to accomplish goals. The Intern will work on assignments under the guidance of staff and provide hands-on support for process improvement and or floor layouts associated with the manufacturing of complex life science instruments. The Intern will need to have the ability to work through adverse situations while building and maintaining good personal relationships.
Justification
The intern is needed to support Factory Model Projects in instrument Ops and other Production and Mfg. engineering projects.

Job Description
Essentials functions:

Summer Internship will focus on supporting Quality and Production Operations in improving internal Quality Metrics

Provides hands on support for process improvements to the manufacturing assembly and test processes for flow cytometry instrument under the supervision of Staff Manufacturing Engineers or Production Managers.
Must have the ability to solve problems, and determine root cause of technical issues related to (process, time and motion studies, floor or work cell layout, resources capacity, ergonomics and other related improvements). Must be able to implement effective solutions in a timely manner.

Strives to continuously improve processes in order to achieve optimal efficiency for manufacturing operations.

Will serve as a member of cross functional project teams. Major objectives may include: product cost reduction efforts, designing processes to improve manufacturing operational efficiency, optimize product design, qualify replacement components, improve product quality, improve customer satisfaction, and reduce manufacturing costs.

Develops and implements strategies to optimize material and workflow.
Must be able to develop and maintain good working relationships with internal customers, primarily line level production personnel, other ME's, QA, Planners, Purchasing, R&D and managers.

Ensures that manufacturing procedures and appropriate levels of process control are in place and meet regulatory GMP's. Brings regulatory compliance questions and issues to the attention of management as necessary.

Keeps abreast of the basic requirements for compliance in own area of work and complies with those requirements. Participates as required in training on regulatory issues affecting own area of work. Brings regulatory compliance questions/issues to the attention of management.

Promotes a safe work environment. Provide recommendations on maintaining the safety of the work environment. Participates in Environmental, Health and Safety programs. Addresses corrective actions whenever a hazard is identified. Notifies manager of all observed hazardous conditions or unsafe work practices.

Minimum Requirements:

Must be currently pursuing a BS degree in Industrial Engineering (third year or higher) or similar BS degree.
Must be proficient in the use of personal computers.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, must have good interpersonal skills: conflict resolution, negotiation, and the ability work in a team environment

Desirable Qualifications:

Experience implementing LEAN manufacturing processes
6 Sigma green or black belt courses
Project management courses
Experience with engineering drawings, Bills of Materials, and operational procedures
Experience writing and reviewing Engineering Change Orders
Experience implementing continuous improvement solutions
Experience developing manufacturing processes, writing procedures, and training assembly personnel
The ability to assess and resolve problems in a timely manner.
Familiarity with ISO 13485 standards
Familiarity of the following applications: Pro-E, AutoCAD, MS Access, SAP ERP, Visio.
Experience supporting some of the following commodities or supplier types: lasers, optical components, fluidic systems, machined parts, sheet metal, cables, PCA's, plastics, power systems, product packaging, turnkey subcontractors, hardware, labeling, bar code systems
cGMP familiarity 21 CFR part 820, medical device manufacturing experience##

Habitat for Humanity Wake County is currently seeking a talented professional for the Directory of Advocacy position.
Reporting to the President/CEO, the Director of Advocacy is responsible for leading the affiliateâs advocacy efforts by promoting policies and systems that eliminate barriers to affordable housing. The Director of Advocacy will lead the department in conducting public education and awareness activities to highlight the importance of housing affordability in our community and build political will for change.

Policy advocacy and governmental affairs:

Provide leadership in setting and implementing Habitat Wakeâs advocacy agenda, policy priorities, and strategy.
Lead Habitat Wakeâs policy advocacy efforts, which are primarily focused at the local/regional level with some engagement at state and national levels in collaboration with Habitat North Carolina and Habitat for Humanity International.
Champion Habitat Wakeâs participation in HFHIâs Cost of Home national advocacy campaign.
Guide Habitat Wakeâs involvement in Habitat NCâs and Habitat for Humanity International (HFHI)âs state, national and global housing policy efforts.
Build and maintain strong relationships with local, state, and national policymakers to position Habitat Wake as a trusted advisor on housing issues.
Support the development review processes for Habitat Wake projects and mobilize the network to contact elected officials in support when needed.

Public awareness and education:

Speak on behalf of Habitat Wake to promote its advocacy agenda in collaboration with the CEO.
Raise awareness for equitable housing policies and call out systems that perpetuate the need for Habitat, especially through a racial justice lens.
Partner with the Communications department to set advocacy communications strategy, including key messaging, media, public relations, and online engagement.
Position Habitat Wake as a thought leader and resource on affordable housing, especially regarding homeownership
Educate policymakers and community leaders on housing policy and issues affecting Habitat Wakeâs ability to further its mission.

Community partnerships:

Forge partnerships with organizations across the housing continuum so that all may work together to advance access to housing affordability.
Provide leadership for Wake Affordable Housing Coalition (WAHC) in its efforts to promote local housing solutions through a shared agenda.

Grassroots mobilizing:

Lead efforts to engage Habitat Wakeâs constituency with housing advocacy messages and present opportunities for stakeholders to take action.
Facilitate Habitat Wakeâs involvement in network-wide advocacy events, including Habitat NC Legislative Day, Habitat NC Week of Action, Habitat on the Hill, World Habitat Day, etc.
Recruit board members, advocacy committee and homebuyers to participate in HFHIâs national lobby day, Habitat on the Hill.
Work with the Homeownership Services team to empower homebuyers and neighborhood residents to become housing advocates.
Partner with the Faith Relations department to engage faith coalitions in advocacy from a faith-based justice perspective

Research and analysis:

Oversee research activities to provide analysis that supports the public awareness and policy objectives of the organization.

Strategic planning and departmental leadership:

Set the strategy for Habitat Wakeâs advocacy initiatives in collaboration with the Advocacy Committee and CEO.
Represent the advocacy function on Habitat Wakeâs senior leadership team.
Supervise the Advocacy Coordinator role and other staff/intern/volunteer positions within the department.
Manage department budget and track expenditures.
Report advocacy metrics and progress on a monthly basis.
Develop monthly reports for the Advocacy Committee and Board of Directors.
Engage in strategic planning to set annual objectives within the context of Habitat Wakeâs organizational goals.

Advocacy Committee:

Work with the Advocacy Committee chair to set meeting agendas.

Ability to establish and maintain collaborative working relationships with Habitat Wake staff, Advocacy Committee, community partners, and policymakers.

Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team and with great energy and persistence.
