Bachelorâs degree in political science, public affairs, public policy, communications, or related field; Masterâs degree preferred.

position: Local College Co-op - Emergency Services & Security
description:
Dow has an exciting part-time cooperative education job opportunity available in Midland, MI. This position is open to qualified and highly-committed college students enrolled in a fully accredited college or university located very close to the Midland Dow site. Unlike a short-term internship project outside of school terms, this particular role is a long-term, year-round, undergraduate student position -- at least one full year in duration -- while the student is simultaneously taking classes toward an undergraduate degree. This opportunity offers the student valuable professional work experience in a dynamic, multi-national corporation interfacing with colleagues and leaders in many different roles. This program is designed for academically successful students who meet ALL of the specific job and co-op program requirements listed below and who can simultaneously succeed both in school and in a professional work environment.

   

Job Purpose

This position of a Student Security Officer within the Emergency Services & Security (ES&S) department exists to provide security and process the flow of personnel and materials at the gate locations of the Midland area corporate, manufacturing and research locations.

Key Job Responsibilities

Key responsibilities include, but not limited to:

  • Performing vehicle inspections

  • Effective, professional and helpful communication and conduct with employees, customers, suppliers, etc.

  • Enforcement of security procedures

  • Documentation for visitors and materials in and out of Dow facilities

  • Monitoring/operation security and access control systems, security alarms, badge programming/creation, camera operations, and tracking system for shipping of dry and bulk materials.

Required & Preferred Qualifications

  • Must be pursuing an undergrad degree from a fully accredited college or university near the Dow Midland, MI site.

  • A major in criminal justice or fire science is preferred but not required. 

  • During vehicle inspections, the student must be able to climb in and out of vehicles, including semi-trucks.

  • Depending on the shift that is available, there is a potential to work a shift other than a day shift.

  • The student will periodically need to operate a vehicle during their assignment; therefore, a valid driver's license and safe driving is required.

  • During winter months, salting and shoveling the sidewalks are also required.

  • Candidates must have good interpersonal skills.

  • Candidates must be able to multitask during emergency and normal operational situations and have the ability to change priorities as needed.

  • Teamwork and cooperation are essential, as well as taking independent initiative on things that need to be done.

  • Candidates must be knowledgeable with computers and Microsoft applications, especially using Word, Excel and Outlook.

Critical Requirements of the Local Student Co-Op Program

  • High school diploma/GED and already enrolled at an accredited college or university located close to the Midland Dow site, pursuing an undergraduate degree.

  • Successfully complete a minimum of 6 credit hours per term during both the Fall and Winter terms (~Sept-Apr).

  • Seeking high performing student with strong GPAs of 3.000+; however, a minimum 2.700+ term and cumulative GPA on a 4.000 scale is required at ALL times â both to enter and to continue working in the Dow co-op program.  Attach a screen capture from your schoolâs website or a copy of your most recent transcripts/grade report showing classes and recent GPAs to this application.  Eligibility to continue in this cooperative education program is checked every term.

  • Able to begin work very soon, usually within 3 weeks of the job offer, and work year-round at least 20 hours each week ONLY during our regular business hours (8am-5pm, Mon-Friâ¦max 8 hours/day and 30/week during school).

  • Commit to the role for at least 1 full calendar year (BEFORE completing classes for your stated undergraduate degree or BEFORE transferring out of the area).  Students available longer than one year before completing their degree program are preferred and advantaged. 

  • Reliable attendance and punctuality in commuting to work daily or at least 3 days a week; therefore, dependable transportation, dedication and time management skills are absolutely required. 

  • Registered/enrolled in their school's Cooperative Education Program before the first day at Dow and comply with the schoolâs policies/requirements, in addition to Dow's, for the duration of co-op employment. 

  • Any current Dow college co-ops wishing to transfer into this role must have been in their current role at least one full year, must have at least one full year left before graduating or transferring out of the area, and must have supervisor approval before applying to each Dow co-op job posting.

Candidates who receive a job offer will be required to pass a background check and drug screen/medical evaluation and will verify school-related requirements and I-9 documentation before being hired into Dow.

A minimum requirement for this U.S. based position is the ability to work legally in the United States.  No visa sponsorship/support is available for this position, including for any type of U.S. permanent residency (green card) process.

About Dow

 

Dow (NYSE: DOW) combines global breadth, asset integration and scale, focused innovation and leading business positions to achieve profitable growth. The Companyâs ambition is to become the most innovative, customer centric, inclusive and sustainable materials science company, with a purpose to deliver a sustainable future for the world through our materials science expertise and collaboration with our partners. Dowâs portfolio of plastics, industrial intermediates, coatings and silicones businesses delivers a broad range of differentiated science-based products and solutions for its customers in high-growth market segments, such as packaging, infrastructure, mobility and consumer care. Dow operates 106 manufacturing sites in 31 countries and employs approximately 35,700 people. Dow delivered sales of approximately $39 billion in 2020. References to Dow or the Company mean Dow Inc. and its subsidiaries. For more information, please visit www.dow.com or follow @DowNewsroom on Twitter.


 As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Dow is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at http://www.dow.com/en-us/contact-us or you may call us at 1-800-523-3945.

position: Staff Engineer, Process Technology Development R&D
description:
Job Location: Hershey, PA
 


 


Summary:  
The Staff Engineer uses process engineering and food science principles to lead process development research projects and programs.  One key focus area of current research will be leadership of chocolate process development research related to better for you initiatives and sugar reduction, from benchtop to pilot scale, and commercialization supporting both ingredient development and finished product.  Additionally, he/she will lead program technical strategy development, project design and methodology, test ideas through experimentation, and determine next steps through problem solving.  The successful candidate will be leading projects of higher complexity and apply technical rigor to ensure project goals and business objectives are achieved.  He/she will need to be able to prioritize his/her work and contribute to strategic directions within R&D.  He/she will progress technical research, by disciplined application of the scientific method through the project management process and the transfer of knowledge to Product Development, Commercialization and/or Operations teams. Hands-on skills involving running laboratory and pilot plant equipment is required.  In addition to working with R&D team members, the staff engineer is expected to be able to work along side our cross-functional partners in Marketing, Product Development, Sensory, Manufacturing, Legal, Engineering, Quality and other Supply Chain  departments as well as our M&A partners. The successful candidate will report to the groupâs Principal Engineer. 


 


Summary of major duties:



  • Actively seek new technologies and innovation opportunities. 

  • Lead chocolate process technology development worksteams for both ingredient development and finished products from bench top to pilot to commercial scale which may focus on BFY chocolate process development.

  • Lead complex process development and process validation to support product commercialization in various areas for the Hershey Company.

  • Test ideas through experimental design, collect and analyze data using analytical process tools to provide recommendations.

  • Determine next steps through problem solving. 

  • Collaborate with cross-functional groups to ideate, identify, develop solutions, and commercialize new technologies. 

  • Have a good understanding of current processing technologies across snacks and confectionery industry and continue to explore new and breakthrough technologies.

  • Mentor and guide junior scientists and engineers within R&D. 

  • Provide leadership and instruction to technicians. 

  • Ability to connect and interact with peers from other within and other industries  to exchange information and ideas in area of expertise where appropriate.


 


Process development; lab & pilot-plant equipment operation



  • Operate or direct the operation of lab or pilot-plant equipment in the

  • performance of  tests or experiments. Lead the development of new 

  • processes through research and experimentation to deliver project results.

  • Hands-on work involving running lab, pilot plant and factory equipment.   



Research design/data analysis/report writing/ presentation  



  • Design and execute experiments, analyze data and provide conclusions using an appropriate statistical tool. Prepare all project reports as required.  Make presentations of significant results to drive business decisions.



Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities:

â¢    Understanding of the fundamentals of chocolate including formulations, manufacturing, forming, and downstream processes. 
â¢    Understanding of the impact of the key processing parameters in the conversion of raw ingredient and in-process material to finished product. 
â¢    Demonstrated excellence in project leadership and decision making ability.
â¢    Comfortable with operating pilot plant and/or lab equipment. 
â¢    Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
â¢    Demonstrated mathematical and statistical skills. 
â¢    Possesses computer skills (basic knowledge of Word, Access, Excel, Exchange)
â¢    Ability to work in a team environment and independently in a flexible work environment with changing priorities. 



Minimum Education and Experience Requirements:

Experience: 5-10+ years (B.S. food/engineering degree) or 3-5+ years (M.S.) in R&D environment  in process development, process validation, food engineering.  Intern and prior research project work will be considered. 
Experience in chocolate processing is a plus.

Summary and Objective

A-Tech, LLC, A BlueHalo Company (ATA) has an opportunity for a Computer Science student. The Internship Program at HealthStream will enable you to grow personally and professionally by providing you with real-world experience in one of the top healthcare IT companies in the United States. In HealthStream's Internship Program, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects in a stimulating, collaborative environment. This experience, in partnership with your coursework, will set you up on a road for career success.

In this position you will work in a software development team to help develop serverless software in the cloud as part of Healthstream's hStream initiative.

The team built and now uses & maintains an in-house cloud based tool for developing serverless software on AWS. You'll be helping to build a new release of this tool.

In this internship you'll get experience working on a serverless Python-based back end system using AWS Lambda and a React-based web front end (Javascript) on AWS, using cutting edge technologies and techniques.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES OR RESPONSIBILITIES - (The below listed duties are not all inclusive. This position must also perform other duties as assigned.):

- Develop software

- Write documentation

- Use source control systems

- Work effectively both on your own and in a team environment

  • A degree in computer science (can be underway) or equivalent or similar.

  • Transcripts may be requested at any point during the interviewing process (unofficial transcripts acceptable).

2. SKILLS REQUIRED (manual, verbal or mental manipulation of data or things):
  • Some solid exposure to and experience computer programming
  • Preferably coursework heavily involving programming
  • Python and/or Javascript skills highly desirable

3. ABILITIES REQUIRED (work characteristics, behaviors, leadership abilities, etc.):
  • Grit: the ability to keep going when the work is hard / confusing
  • Ability to work with others.
  • Creativity and Curiosity
  • A passion for computers and software
  • Must be a full-time student at an accredited university
  • Upperclassmen (Juniors and Seniors) as well as graduate-level students will be considered
  • Interns are expected to work 20 hours a week for the September-December internship period. Internship will cover dates starting in September and ending in December, with some flexibility on dates given varying school schedules.
  • This is a paid internship; pay starts at $12/hr for the Internship Program

position: Technical Intern - Tactical Mission Analyst Modeling & Simulation
description:
Powered by endlessly curious people with an unwavering mission focus, Ball Aerospace pioneers discoveries that enable our customers to perform beyond expectation and protect what matters most.


We create innovative space solutions, enable more accurate weather forecasts, drive insightful observations of our planet, deliver actionable data and intelligence, and ensure those who defend our freedom go forward bravely and return home safely. For more information, visit Ball Aerospace Career Site or connect with us on LinkedIn , Facebook , Twitter or Instagram .


The Tactical Solutions Strategic Business Unit delivers mission system solutions, from specialized antennas to electro-optical technologies, to the warfighter. Our systems enhance the performance of various military platforms, from aircraft and land vehicles to ships and satellites, and give warfighters the advantage they need to take action, identify targets and defend against evolving threats.


Weâre committed to building a more diverse and representative Ball Aerospace. The GO BEYONDÂ® Diversity Internship is a paid fall internship program for undergraduate and graduate students who are enrolled in degree-seeking programs and interested in working in the Aerospace industry. Students from any university who identify with a group that is historically underrepresented, including but not limited to Black, Hispanic, Asian, Native American, and women/gender minorities, are encouraged to apply.


Technical Intern â Tactical Mission Analyst Modeling & Simulation


Do you love solving problems and have a passion to understand how things work? Does learning new fields and applying your analytical skills to real-life problems sound like your dream job? If so, you might be the undergraduate intern that Ball Aerospace is seeking to support our mission analysis team.


Join our small, collaborative team working on exciting new problems in the defense world to help the warfighter and to help bring our troops home safely.


This is an opportunity to use and develop many of the tools in your toolbox, including mathematics, coding, and public speaking. Our agile, tight-knit group chooses what we work on from a list of new, interesting, and challenging problems. By applying mathematics and first-principles physics, we solve difficult engineering problems across a wide span of technologies and disciplines.


Based in Westminster, Colorado, Ball Aerospace Tactical Solutions applies radio frequency and electro-optical technologies to the nationâs defense needs. With over 60 years of heritage, our products are installed on an ever-growing list of our nationâs platforms.


What Youâll Do:


+ Generate MATLAB models of system performance using our simulation framework and first-principles physics.

+ Develop MATLAB code for simulation framework and data processing using GIT version control.

+ Write unit tests for new methods and increase overall framework coverage.

+ Identify algorithm improvements necessary to expand simulation capability.

+ Determine if a system can accomplish its mission in a variety of complex scenarios based on simulated model.

+ Learn new fields and technologies while identifying the appropriate level of model fidelity required.

+ Present and defend your analysis to peers, management, and customers.

+ Assist with meeting project milestones and providing solutions to a variety of technical problems.

+ Maintain a regular and predictable work schedule.

+ Establish and maintain effective working relationships within the department, the Strategic Business Units, Strategic Support Units and the Company. Interact appropriately with others in order to maintain a positive and productive work environment.

+ Perform other duties as necessary.


What Youâll Need:


+ Must have completed your sophomore or junior year and be enrolled in a degree-seeking programs. We will also accept students enrolled in a graduate program.

+ Degree must be from a university, college, or school which is accredited by an agency recognized by the US Secretary of Education, US Department of Education.

+ Excellent analytical, mathematical, and communication skills, as well as knowledge of MATLAB and object-oriented programming.

+ Interest or knowledge in electromagnetics, antennas, RF technology, optics, signal processing, and/or electronic warfare is preferred.

+ Degree program in Physics, Engineering Physics, Applied Physics, or Computer Science preferred with coursework or dual-major in Applied Math or Electrical Engineering.


Working Conditions:


+ Work is performed in an office environment, laboratory, cleanroom, or production floor.

+ Travel and local commute between Ball campuses and other possible non-Ball locations may be required.


Relocation for this position is available.


Compensation & Benefits:


+ HIRING SALARY RANGE: $19.30 - $27.50 per hour (Salary to be determined by the education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.)

+ Temporary positions typically are not eligible for benefits. For details, copy and paste https://bit.ly/3pNSnxv into your browser or visit our careers site.


US CITIZENSHIP MAY BE REQUIRED

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Insights into your Role:


The Cloud Platform organization is responsible for Core Virtualization products such as vSphere, Workstation, Fusion and other Solutions for Enterprise Virtualization. The vSphere Data Protection team is part of the Cloud Platform Organization and is responsible for development of next generation solutions for protecting customer data and services. The team develops both control plane services as well as low level IO filter and data path components that allow for non-intrusive data capture and replication for either backup or disaster recovery product offerings.

You will work closely with a mentor that will guide you on the design and implementation of multi-threaded server code providing the ability to use low cost cloud storage for data protection.

This is a Process Control Internship position in Automation at the CITGO Corpus Christi Refinery. This position is located in the Automation Department. The Intern will become familiar with Process Control and how it applies to the Refinery process.

 

Headquartered in Houston, Texas, CITGO Petroleum Corporation is a recognized leader in the refining industry with a well-known brand. CITGO operates three refineries located in Corpus Christi, Texas; Lake Charles, La.; and Lemont, Ill., and wholly and/or jointly owns 48 terminals, nine pipelines and three lubricants blending and packaging plants. With approximately 3,500 employees and a combined crude capacity of approximately 769,000 barrels-per-day (bpd), CITGO is ranked as the fifth-largest, and one of the most complex independent refiners in the United States. CITGO transports and markets transportation fuels, lubricants, petrochemicals and other industrial products and supplies a network of approximately 4,900 locally owned and operated branded retail outlets in 30 states and the District of Columbia. position: Computer Science Intern - Finance Summer Internship
description:
Company Description

Stratas Foods LLC is the leading supplier of fats and oils to the Foodservice, Food Ingredients and Retail Private Label markets in North America and is a producer of quality bulk and packaged dressings, mayonnaise and sauces. Stratas Foods was formed in October 2008 as a 50/50 joint venture between ACH Food Companies (ACH) and Archer Daniels Midland (ADM).

Manufacturing facilities are located in Dallas and Houston, TX; Decatur and Quincy, IL; Englewood, NJ; Fresno, CA; Nashville, TN; and Valdosta, GA.  Corporate offices are located in Memphis, TN.  We are committed to maintaining a progressive workplace by utilizing the ideas, skills and talents of all of our employees.  We strive to make Stratas Foods a great place to work and are building a team capable of meeting our business goals.

Job Description

The Stratas Finance Team has an exciting opportunity for a talented Information Computer Science intern to help build small scale applications.   As an intern with Stratas Foods, you will not only work with and learn from industry professionals, but you will also share in the culture of teamwork at Stratas Foods.  

As an intern, key responsibilities will include the following:

  1. Conduct needs analysis
  2. Build small scale applications for the finance department based on business needs
  3. Work with the IT Department and Master Data Governance Team
Qualifications

  • An individual who has at least 1-2 years of undergraduate studies remaining
  • A concentration in Information Technology or related field
  • Application development background through any of the RAD (Rapid Application Development) softwares
  • Strong communication skills
  • A highly motivated self-starter
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel and Macros
  • Proficient in SQL â Nice to have
  • Proficient in PowerBI â Nice to have
  • Critical Thinker


Additional Information

Competencies:

Communications â Strong negotiation and interpersonal skills in dealing with those both internal and external to Stratas are critical to success

Leadership - Ability to lead others in the directions necessary to achieve mutually beneficial goals is important

Analytical Skills â Having both the ability and competency to evaluate a variety of alternatives and pick the best solution in a dynamic work environment

Root cause problem-solving techniques:  Critical to a line manufacturing process

Developing teamwork and productivity:  Being proactive in employee relations efforts serves all well

Stratas Foods is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any applicant or employee in any manner prohibited by law, including but not limited to, on the basis of race or color, religion, gender, age, genetic information, national origin/ancestry, mental or physical disability, family status/marital status, sexual orientation, military/veteran status, and any other legally protected status.

Tired of web companies masquerading as tech startups? Looking for real development, with real impact

Overview:

This internship position is to support the computer vision and machine learning team in the development of deep neural network solutions designed to run on our latest low-power AI chip Katana. The internship will include several exciting and challenging tasks, mostly focused on analysing the training\testing data, and designing and implementing creative techniques for improving and extending the data, including planning and conducting additional data collections and annotations, and running machine learning tools against the data. The intern will have significant interactions with the team members, and will have exposure to the latest computer vision and machine learning techniques.  

Responsibilities:
  • Analyze the current training\testing data, and produce reports\spreadsheets\visualizations describing the data quality, coverage, features, and identify collection\labeling errors.
  • Design and implement creative scientific techniques for improving and extending the training\testing data.
  • Design and implement ways for improving data organization, storage, formats.
  • Design and implement creative techniques for improving the data collection process.
  • Organize and conduct new data collections.
  • Apply statistical, mathematical, and software skills to support machine learning model development.
  • Run ML training tools against the data.
  • Analyze the performance of the system, and summarize the failure patterns\areas of improvement.
Qualifications:
  • Currently enrolled as a student, with 1+ years of relevant work experience in an accredited Bachelors, Masters or PhD program within the United States.
  • Majoring in computer engineering, computer science, or a relevant field.
  • Passion for machine learning, computer vision, and data analysis.
  • 1+ years of experience in coding in Python, and debugging skills.
  • Highly analytical, attentive to detail, curious, self-starter.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Team player

IT Network or Security Operation Center experience. Experience in computer network defense and in-depth technical knowledge/mastery with intrusion detection systems. Description
IMPORTANT NOTES
1. REQUIRED: Concrete experience in reinforcement learning that goes beyond downloading an RL codebase and running it.
2. Data science and 'concrete' experience in RL are very different â the latter requires prowess both in mathematics and computer science, REQUIRED for this role. This difference is paramount.
?Just because someone has Client and Python on their CVs do not qualify them for RL.
3. Look for people (a) who have published in the field of RL in top conferences i.e., original contribution, or (b) have a codebase that is original in GitHub/Bitbucket.

###

We seek candidates who have the skills and research experience to join a new team to push the boundaries of pure mathematics, theoretical statistics (incl. parametric and non-parametric Bayesian statistics) and machine learning (primarily in deep reinforcement learning). A proven record of publications (at least one first-author paper in reputed conferences such as NeurIPS, COLT, UAI, ICML, AISTATS, JMLR, PAMI, and others) and prototyping skills in terms of developing algorithms, in any language, is critical.

As an industry R&D laboratory, we pursue theoretical and applied research to feed into the other. Like academia, knowledge dissemination is through the publication of papers in reputed journals, conferences and workshops, and patents. position: SAP SF CTO iXpIntern - Full Stack Software Engineer (Cloud, AI/ML, REACT, Containers/K8s)
description:
Requisition ID: 282262

Work Area: Software-Design and Development

Expected Travel: 0 - 10%

Career Status: Student

Employment Type: Intern


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. Thats why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.


SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because its the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve peoples lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAPs global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP


1. Culture of collaboration : meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.

2. Project-driven experience : gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.

3. Gain visibility : with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, youll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team


We are a small on-site team belonging to CTO Organization that works on some of the most exciting, challenging and innovative technologies (Cloud computing, Automated CI/CD, Kubernetes, Docker, MS Azure, Machine Learning / AI, Security, SAP HANA etc.) to help effect changes across the technology spectrum to solve the most important business problems at SAP SuccessFactors.


If you find working on exciting technical problems fun along onsite snacks, beverages and games (Pool, Ping Pong) while engaging in cross functional partnership with various teams across the company you would enjoy being part of our team.


What youll do:


Position title: SAP SF CTO iXpIntern - Full Stack Software Engineer (Cloud, AI/ML, REACT, Containers/K8s)


Location: Palo Alto, CA (virtual)


Expected start date to end date: July - September 2021


In this role, youll:


Want to work on latest, most innovative topics in world of Technology? Cloud Computing, Containers, Kubernetes, Security, AI/ML? Do you love a challenge? Do you like breaking down problems and finding solutions Do you want to be part of a team that would have significant impact in technical decisions that would have Enterprise wide impact? If so, this is your opportunity to work with a variety of cutting-edge technologies at SAP SuccessFactors. Youll have the opportunity to break down problems and find solutions while working in a forward-thinking team environment.


As an Architecture Solutions Engineer you will work in a small team reporting directly into the CTOs (Chief Technology Officers) organization that would focus on Innovation, Architectural and Technical Strategy on a variety of highly important technical topics including: Enterprise Cloud Transformation, enhancing SAP SuccessFactors HCM suite, CI/CD, Building of an Intelligent Next Generation PaaS, Test Automation, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Security Automation, Automated DevOps as part of building an Intelligent Enterprise using latest and greatest cutting edge technologies including Golang, Python, Java, Kubernetes, Docker, Python, Jenkins 2.0, ArgoCD, SAP HANA, Azure Cloud, SAP Cloud Platform, TensorFlow and a lot more.


As an Architecture Solutions Engineer Intern, your job duties will include:


+ Be a part of a small team, directly reporting into the CTO organization working on SAP SuccessFactors top technical enterprise-wide priorities (e.g. Automated Modern CI/CD for Azure Cloud, building of an Intelligent Cloud First Next Generation PaaS (Platform as a Service, Containers/Kubernetes, Security, AI/ML), Microservices, Software Design Patterns

+ Design & Implement in language of your choice: services, capabilities, systems as part of Platform as a Service for Automated release of Microservices.

+ Adopt the latest open source tools and technologies for use in SAP context

+ Dig into the analysis to decompose portions of the monolith into manageable, understandable insights.

+ Experiment with emerging technologies or those coming from SAP to be the tip of the spear to help provide guidance for teams before adoption.

+ Design, implement and manage world class self-healing Cloud Platforms / Frameworks

+ Build/Enhance/Evaluate applications/tools for build, test, deployment automation to meet business needs with respect to functionality, performance, scalability and other quality goals.

+ Apply technical expertise to challenging programming and design problems

+ Be passionate about keeping up-to-date with latest technology and the technology for our products.

+ Build tools to automate deployment to Azure cloud and private data center servers.

+ Perform debugging, problem solving and resolve defects / bugs as required

+ Demonstrate a passion for developing well architected, elegant software tools and services


Who you are:


Were looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS/ SKILLS


+ Student currently enrolled in field of Computer Science (Major focus) or similar field.

+ Experience in multiple programming languages is desirable - Golang, Python

+ Experience in Linux Administration

+ Experience working on any Cloud Platform (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud)

+ Strong interest in areas of Cloud Computing, AI/ML, Security, Containers & Kubernetes

+ Good understanding of Object Oriented Programming, Design Patterns, Exception Handling

+ Experience in multi-threaded programming

+ Understanding of System Integration

+ Understanding of API design and RESTful principles

+ JavaScript / Node.js, REACT, UI5 experience is a plus


COMPETENCIES


+ Strong computer science fundamentals, data structures, and algorithms

+ Ability to learn new products, technologies and programming languages quickly

+ Excellent problem-solving skills; can triage and resolve critical tech issues without supervision

+ High standards for development quality, especially on unit testing, TDD / BDT, and automated testing Technical Specifics.

+ Strong work ethics, driven, dependable, and responsible

+ Team player, proactive networking attributes, results and execution focused, self-starter

+ Willingness and ability to learn quickly new Big Data and Cloud Analytics solutions

+ Ability to stay on top of technology innovations and eager to continuously learn

+ Willingness to participate in sales process, if needed, as a subject matter expert

+ Motivated, and able to work effectively under pressure situations

+ Must possess the ability to learn multiple areas of a new technology and expand current technical and advisory knowledge

+ High energy, clear goal orientation and strong work ethics; can do attitude


Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/sapixp/) and dont miss anything about our experiences worldwide!


WHAT YOU GET FROM US


Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If youre searching for a company thats dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment apply now _._


SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT

To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.


SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com , APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com , EMEA: Careers@sap.com ).


Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.


Additional Locations :

At Saint-Gobain we design, manufacture and distribute materials which are key ingredients in the wellbeing of each of us and the future of all. Join our innovative, passionate and entrepreneurial community to improve the world of tomorrow with us.






With over 60,000 employees working across 46 countries, Saint-Gobainâs Innovative Materials Sector boasts a unique and profitable portfolio of high-tech and high value-added solutions for housing and construction, mobility, healthcare and industry.


A true technology bridgehead for the Saint-Gobain Group, the Innovative Materials Sector is supported by 3 powerful growth drivers: innovation, co-development and research.


In the field of High Performance Materials, it proposes a comprehensive range of innovative technologies targeting the housing and construction market, transport, industry and healthcare, and combined into four families of materials: ceramics, polymers, abrasives and technical fabrics. + Ability to work closely with other employees and departments in the company

Skills and Requirements:

+ Coding or scripting experience, preferably in Python and SQL



+ SCADA or PLC experience is a plus



+ Ability to work Monday-Friday, 8am-4pm during the summer, part-time hours during the school semester to accommodate class schedule



+ Microsoft Suite product experience



+ Good communication skills, high computer literacy and ability to operate in a team environment










Saint-Gobain provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Description/Job Summary

Fruit of the Loom, an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Inc. & leading international basic apparel company, has an immediate opening for a Data Science Intern at its Corporate Headquarters in Bowling Green, KY.

The Data Science Intern supports the company's data-driven objectives by providing advanced analytics insights and recommendations by utilizing data mining techniques, including pattern detection and statistical analysis, and data visualization. This role is expected to work with Data Science and department team members to collaborate with business teams to efficiently and effectively answer business questions. The Data Science internvalidates findings and presents them in ways that can be easily understood by business counterparts. 

Responsibilities/Duties

Data Research and Conversion

  • Work with the business stakeholders to identify what the business requirements are and the expected outcome. Model and frame business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact critical business processes and/or decisions. Identify what data is available and relevant, including internal and external data sources, leveraging new data collection processes such as smart meters and geo-location information or social media.

Data Validation and Presentation

  • Work in iterative processes with the business and validate findings. For example, validate discovered correlations across data with the business. Discovered findings can appear counter intuitive. Expose the rationale to their findings in easy to understand terms for the business. Be prepared to present back results that contradict common belief. Suggest ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information.

Required Experience

  • Undergraduate or graduate student majoring in Computer Science, Business Informatics, Statistics or Mathematics or related field, or equivalent years of professional experience
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required
  • Programming knowledge and skills, experience with statistical programming software (i.e. R, Python), and knowledge of database query languages (i.e. SQL)
  • Ability to identify solutions to loosely defined business problems by leveraging pattern detection over potentially large datasets
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
  • Knowledge of statistical forecasting and machine concepts (i.e. decomposition, linear regression, exponential smoothing, support vector machine, k-means clustering, boosted decision-tree) and software (i.e. R, STATA, Weka, Python)
  • Data visualization experience using PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview, or similar technology

Required Qualifications

  • 0-2 years of experience with data and statistical analysis, with mathematical modeling skills

position: Fall 2021-IT and Ops Engineering Intern - 90291086 - Philadelphia (Philadelphia, PA, US, 19104)
description:
Your success is a train ride away.

Amtrak connects businesses and communities across the country and we move Americaâs workforce toward the future. We employ more than 20,000 diverse, energetic professionals in a variety of career fields throughout the United States. The safety of our passengers, our employees, the public and our operating environment is our priority and the success of our railroad is the result of our employees.

Are you ready to join our team?

SUMMARY OF DUTIES

The internship is an exciting opportunity to learn about train control systems including dispatching and Positive Train Control (PTC) systems which are critical to sustaining and enhancing safety of the intercity travel network.  The intern will work collaboratively with Amtrak staff across IT and Operations Engineering projects. The intern will have an opportunity to learn broadly about Amtrak's business practices while being charged with focused technical research projects with support and guidance from Amtrak senior staff. 


Amtrak provides rail transportation, as well as connecting services operated by partner carriers.  The internship will focus on improvements to multimodal travel that combines Amtrak with other forms of transportation.  This may include enhancements to technology systems in train dispatch, ET SCADA & PTC systems.  The intern may also undertake research on developing new routes that connect with Amtrak. 


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Work under the supervision of assigned IT Manager(s).
  • Create maps and diagrams of train track in dispatch Territory.
  • Design & development of reporting system.
  • Compile data from written sources as well as direct interviews. 
  • Write clearly and succinctly on technical topics. 
  • Create documentation of technical processes and best practices in layman terms. 

 

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Must be actively pursuing a degree at an accredited educational institution.  
  • Must be actively pursuing an undergraduate degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science.
  • Must have at least 2 years of academic undergraduate studies completed or a junior status at minimum.  
  • Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.

 

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience with computer programming and/or application design. 
  • Knowledge of Database programming (MySQL and MS-Access).
  • Knowledge of Networkin Routers, Switches, Firewalls, VLANs. 
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Server, Domain and Workstation Architectures and Administrationâ¢â¯Linux and/or Windows Programming. 
  • Configuration and/or Data Management. 
  • Knowledge of X-Windows, Motif under Linux environment.
  • Knowledge of C++, C, Java and scripting languages under Linux environment.
  • Eclipse / Bit Bucket Development environment.  
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and CAD software. 

 

COMMUNICATIONS AND INTERPERSONAL SKILLS: 
Must have excellent written and oral communication skills.

About Gro:

Gro Intelligence is tackling two of the biggest problems facing the world today: food security and climate change. We understand and quantify the complex interplay between food, weather, trade, agriculture, and macroeconomic conditions in a world upended by climate change, a growing population, and more. The team at Gro has built a platform that allows businesses, non-profits, and governments to better plan for and adapt to these changes. With offices in both Nairobi and New York, Gro has the financial backing of prominent investors such as TPG Growth, Intel Capital, Data Collective, and GGV. Gro is a diverse, intellectually curious team of technologists, scientists, and business professionals united by a shared commitment to build AI that addresses agriculture, food, and our climate on the most fundamental level.

What You'll Do:

  • Build the web-based user interface of the Gro Intelligence Excel Add-in and migrate the application to a more modern front-end framework (e.g Angular, React)
  • Explore new methods and technologies to improve user experience and system performance.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to deliver on the product vision.

Qualifications:

  • Knowledge in Object-oriented programming and CS fundamentals (algorithms, data structures)
  • Familiar with modern web development concepts
  • Experience with server-side JavaScript and one or more modern front end frameworks (e.g Angular, React)
  • Proficient in HTML & CSS, comfortable with jQuery
  • Experience in building design system and modularized UI library

What We're Looking For:

  • The ideal candidate will have built and deployed software services at scale
  • Knows what it takes to ship high quality code
  • A builder of productive and collaborative teams
  • A great team player â you have a point of view, and know how to humbly raise it
  • Care about user experience and have an eye for good design
  • Be open-minded to languages/tools/frameworks to use in order to solve a particular problem. You're excited to learn something new when the need arises.

Bonus Points:

  • Experience in building UI with complicated interactions and animations
  • Background in Computer Science or related field
  • Experience with other backend languages (e.g python, Go, C++ ,Java)
  • Familiar with SQL/NoSQL database
  • Portfolio is a plus

Gro was founded in 2014 and currently has offices in Nairobi and New York City. The company was built on diversity and the knowledge that artificial intelligence is only as good as the human intelligence behind it. Gro's team represents the world it is modeling. At the company, we speak more than 27 languages and we comprise a wide range of experts, from agronomists and crop scientists, to mathematicians, engineers, data scientists, market research analysts, designers, historians, and philosophers. Our culture fosters collaboration between people of extremely different backgrounds that allows us to accomplish things that would otherwise seem impossible. 

Gro Intelligence is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants regardless of color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, actual or presumed belonging to an ethnic group, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

The Position:

We are looking for current Computer Science or Computer Engineering students to join one of our software development teams in Tampa, Florida for an internship. If you are a current student or a student taking a gap year due to COVID and are interested in designing and building unique security software that no one else is building, then this exciting opportunity is for you.  As part of a larger team, you will be given project-oriented work helping develop professional cybersecurity solutions used to protect critical infrastructure around the world.  You will get exposure to every stage of the software development lifecycle, planning, design, coding, testing, and deployment amongst other stages.  

 

What You Will Be Doing:

â¢ Project oriented hands on coding assignments and professional development activities
â¢ Using latest cloud and on-premise technology stacks
â¢ Contributing to the design and architecture of the solutions you work on
â¢ Enhancing the automation testing framework to achieve test driven development
 â¢ Starting your career as a software engineer under the mentorship of experienced team members

 

What We Need From You:

â¢ A passion for Cyber security and learning
â¢ Progress toward a Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science, or a related major
â¢ Examples of extracurricular programing projects (e.g. on Github)
 â¢ Strong collaboration and communication skills

 

About OPSWAT 

OPSWAT is a global leader in critical infrastructure cybersecurity that helps protect the world's mission-critical organizations from malware and zero-day attacks. To minimize the risk of compromise, OPSWAT Critical Infrastructure Protection (CIP) solutions enable both public and private organizations to implement processes that ensure the secure transfer of files and devices to and from critical networks. In total, 98% of U.S. nuclear power facilities and more than 1,000 organizations worldwide spanning Financial Services, Defense, Manufacturing, Energy, Aerospace, Transportation Systems trust OPSWAT to secure their files and devices; ensure compliance with industry and government-driven policies and regulations, and to protect their reputations, finances, employees, and relationships from cyber-driven disruption. For more information, visit www.opswat.com. 

To apply for this position, please send your resume and cover letter to us via JobScore. Special consideration will be given to those candidates whose cover letter indicates that they have viewed our website. Please, no drop-ins, calls, or faxes.

We have a long history of innovation and treating employees with respect, and a deeply held belief in the importance of doing business with integrity.

Schedule


Sunday - Friday, flexible work schedule with hours varying between 7:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m based on student availability and business need. (Approximately 20 hours per week during the school year and up to 28 hours per week during summer months and school breaks).

This is a great opportunity to learn from an experienced team of Food Safety & Quality professionals. The Technical Services Support Intern will be an active part of the team that helps create and manage systems to streamline both the department and T/S supported teams. position: IT Technology Ops/Cloud Engineer & Service Management Intern
description:
Edwards offers its university talent an opportunity to create innovative, life saving devices and techniques that help physicians provide better opportunities for patients around the world. As a global leader in treating advanced cardiovascular disease, we know that millions of people benefit from our passion, our focus, and our innovation.


Key Responsibilities:


â¢ Participate in day-to-day end user support and configuration of business application systems including creating new user accounts, acknowledging tickets, troubleshooting issues and following up with users.


â¢ Participate in authoring test cases and manual testing of systems by following step by step test scripts and documenting test case failures and escalating to team members.


â¢ Perform current-state system analysis and create current/future state system-level process flows and sequence diagrams with guidance from senior Business Systems Analysts


â¢ Partners with business and IT resources to capture and document technical, functional and non-functional requirements


â¢ Responsible for providing business systems analysis services (analyze, define, troubleshoot, design, test, deliver, maintain).


â¢ Basic understanding of project management and software development, Web Architecture, and familiarity with Cloud Based technologies.


â¢ Must have a strong work ethic, organization skills, the desire to learn and is not afraid to ask questions


â¢ Assists in creating and analyzing metrics for strategic business process improvement.


â¢ Knowledge of AWS Cloud Services


â¢ Knowledge of ServiceNow/ITSM platform


â¢ Knowledge of ITIL and reporting tools is a plus


â¢ Proficient with Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Visio.


â¢ Good interpersonal and communication skills


â¢ Ability to prioritize time-sensitive assignments based on input from manager


â¢ Performs administrative duties such as scheduling, coordinating and attending meeting with system users, taking meeting minutes, preparing dashboards and presentations.


Education and Experience:


+ Pursuing Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, information technology or equivalent area of study.

+ Currently enrolled as a student for the duration of the Internship project

+ Must be in good scholastic standing (3.0+ GPA or equivalent).

+ Permanent residency is required


Additional qualifications:


+ Prefer junior or senior, but will consider other class levels.

+ An interest in exposure to Project Management, SaaS technology, Information Technology, Cloud computing.


Edwards is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer including protected Veterans and individuals with disabilities.


Edwards Lifesciences is the global leader in patient-focused medical innovations for structural heart disease, as well as critical care and surgical monitoring. Driven by a passion to help patients, the company collaborates with the world's leading clinicians and researchers to address unmet healthcare needs, working to improve patient outcomes and enhance lives. Headquartered in Irvine, California, Edwards Lifesciences has extensive operations in North America, Europe, Japan, Latin America and Asia and currently employs over 15,000 individuals worldwide.


For us, helping patients is not a slogan - it's our life's work. From developing devices that replace or repair a diseased heart valve to creating new technologies that monitor vital signs in the critical care setting, we focus on helping patients regain and improve the quality of their life.

Overview:

At Tintri, we pride ourselves on challenging convention, so we hire people that choose to see old problems in new ways. The group includes technology geeks and master marketeers, but more importantly it's a collection of people who care deeply about their work. That makes for healthy debate, new ideas and unmatched learning. Our customers adore us because we've built an environment where employees can do their best work every day.   Today, more than 80% workloads are virtualized, but the storage on which those workloads depend was built for a physical world. That forces companies to contort their storage and endure unnecessary complexity. Tintri is the ONLY intelligent infrastructure provider that has architected a solution specifically for virtualized and private cloud environments. Our customers include 6 of the Fortune 15. Bet on brilliant.  Learn more about the  Tintri  portfolio of solutions at  https://www.tintri.com/products

Job Description:

 

Job Title: Intern - Datacenter operations Engineer (DC-Ops Engineer) - Colorado

Responsibilities:

 

  • Deployment, configuration, and sustenance of servers, network switches/routers and storage in DC racks.
  • Schedule and perform maintenance including upgrades, migrations, and managing the production networks.
  •  
  • Coordinate with IT teams to ensure a robust and secure access environment is enabled within the data center
  • Support development, testing and integration of new and existing Server/Storage hardware platforms.
  • Support a resilient virtual infrastructure using VMWare, Kubernetes and similar technologies and be able to manage networks using Cisco and/or Juniper network devices
  • Must be willing to work outside the normal work hours (on-call) on rotation or as needed

 

Required background/skills:

 

  • Computer science, Electronics background (BS, College Diploma preferred)
    • Pursuing candidates welcome
  • Physical capability to lift, rack, stack servers into racks
  • Familiarity with the Windows, Linux and VMware based systems.
    • Must be able to work with basic troubleshooting Linux commands (top, uptime, sar, ifconfig, systemctl, grep, ls, df, du etc.)
  • Willingness to learn new/modern technology stacks (vSphere, ESX, Linux internals, Tanzu, Kubernetes, cloud (AWS))
  • Have a can-do attitude, willing to learn and grow with the evolving needs of the data center operations teams

 

Preferred (Nice to have):

 

  • College diploma or university degree; in the field of computer science preferred or 1+ years equivalent work experience
  • Working knowledge of SAS, SATA, SSD devices and Multi Host NICs.
  • Experience on Virtualization technologies (VMWare, HyperV ) a plus
  • Networking certifications (CCPA, CCNA, TCP/IP, VLAN, Subnet, Routing, OSI models)
  • Experience with field-based work in Data Centers, Colocation Facilities, Internet Exchanges, or Central Offices.
  • Public and/or private cloud experience (AWS, GCP, Azure, Open stack)
  • Experience with scripting and automation (Bash, Python, Perl)

 

Work Conditions:

  • On-call availability
  • Performs maintenance during after-hours or weekend maintenance windows
  • Work from home on occasion
  • Occasional travel

POSITION SUMMARY:

Intern position working in various departments in a Verity office. Students will have the opportunity to work along a specific track throughout the internship program.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES OR RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Project Staffing Program recruits interns on a temporary basis to work on pressing projects for different teams throughout the company. Projects typically fall into one of the following tracks: Product Management, Data Management, Special Projects, Business Development, Sales, and Information Technology.

Qualifications

JOB SPECIFICATIONS:

1. KNOWLEDGE/EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

All majors, at both the undergraduate and graduate level, are invited to apply, particularly students within I.T., MIS, or Computer Science

2. SKILLS REQUIRED:

Strong organizational skills

Interpersonal skills

Collaborate well in a team setting

Communicates effectively with peers and management

Research, writing, data analysis, and project management

Proficiency in Microsoft Office is preferred (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)

Strong Excel skills are an advantage on many projects.

3. ABILITIES REQUIRED:

Ability to work 30-40 hours a week

Ability to learn new material quickly

Entrepreneurial spirit

Take initiative with little direction provided

Overview:

UW Credit Union has a great opportunity for an individual aspiring to pursue a career in the information technology field. The IT Desktop Support Intern will be used to augment the IT End User Services staff. The IT Desktop Support Intern will primarily be responsible for assisting the IT End User Services team with receiving, preparing, and deploying client devices, such as laptops, desktop computers, monitors, and other peripheral devices. This may include installing and testing computer equipment, relocating hardware, and hands-on troubleshooting. This person will also be supporting various department projects and activities.

 

This position is Limited Term. The internship will last 6 months with the opportunity to extend an additional 6 months based on organization/team needs. The individual will work up to 40 hours a week during the summer months and approximately 15-20 hours a week during the school semester. These hours can be flexible to meet your school needs.

 

The IT Desktop Support Intern must effectively carry out the essential duties of this position in a manner that consistently demonstrates the core values of the Organization in a positive manner.

Responsibilities:

1) Preparing and deploying IT hardware - 50%

Assist the End User Services team by receiving new hardware, tracking inventory, imaging laptops and desktop computers, installing and testing hardware. This includes scheduling and coordinating with end users, following a tested process of updating the Operating System, installing required applications, following provided instructions, testing and troubleshooting as needed. Working with the end user to validate that everything is working to their satisfaction.

 

2) Office Moves - 20%

Assist with moving staff from one location to another and move staff from one area of a building to another following a move plan and move schedule. This includes disconnecting and reconnecting PCs, monitors and peripherals as well as documenting cable and switchport details.

Organization: 

The Bail Project is a national nonprofit designed to combat mass incarceration by disrupting the money bail system one person at a time. The Bail Projectâs National Revolving Bail Fund provides free bail assistance to low-income individuals who are legally presumed innocent, and whom a judge has deemed eligible for release before trial contingent on paying bail. We enable our clients to return home to their families and communities while awaiting their court dates, connect them with community organizations that can assist them in accessing resources, and provide reminders and assistance to ensure that clients return to court for their court dates. 

The Intern Program:

The Intern Program invites members of the community, 18 or older, to intern with The Bail Project. All individuals who intern with TBP will be members of a cohort. All interns will be expected to participate in educational opportunities, community-building events, and other cohort activities. Interns will be expected to work 10-15 hours a week based on their availability. All interns will begin work on August 30, 2021. This is a hard start date and we encourage all candidates to consider this requirement carefully.

Position Summary:

TBP is seeking an individual with an interest in criminal legal system reform and improving outcomes for incarcerated and returning community members to assist with several data and research projects to improve TBPâs knowledge of system operations and community resources. This individual will also provide data input support by utilizing Salesforce.

Hours: 10-15 hours per week, flexible schedule

Term: August - November 2021

Start Date: 8/30/21

End Date: 11/30/21

Reports to: Volunteer and Intern Coordinator

Compensation: $15 an hour.

Responsibilities:

  • Document team referrals to social service providers in Salesforce.

  • Document client experiences with social service providers in Salesforce.

  • Use case lookup system to vet potential clients and provide recommendations to Bail Disruptors

  • Use court records and client records to improve TBP understanding of which clients retained private attorneys rather than public defenders and the impact that had on their cases.

  • Use court records and client records to determine which judges set bail for TBP clients.

  • Analyze and present preliminary findings on the degree to which judicial discretion plays a role in determining initial bail affordability and subsequent bail forfeitures for TBP clients.

  • Research client criminal backgrounds to understand past charges in relation to current charges.

  • Develop a list of community institutions and direct service agencies throughout TBPâs service area that may be willing to partner with TBP in providing support for TBP clients, advocate for the use of said institutions and agencies to the team, and add to the database within Salesforce.

  • Research and connect with activist organizations working on criminal justice reform that clients may be interested in joining and advocate for the value in promoting said organizations.

  • Participate in cohort events geared towards social justice, policy, nonprofit management, etc.

  • Engage in weekly or bi-weekly check-ins with supervisor to evaluate progress, identify next steps, etc.

  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

You are driven, highly organized, and have a deep commitment to The Bail Projectâs mission to eliminate race- and wealth-based disparities in our criminal justice system. Weâre looking for someone who is comfortable working independently or in a team-based setting, and with a strong commitment to our clients. 

To excel in this role, you likely bring the following:

  • Passion for understanding and changing the system of mass incarceration and criminal justice

  • Familiarity or personal experience with the local criminal justice system a plus

  • Strong communication skills

  • Interest in data or computer science

  • Basic computer skills and familiarity with spreadsheet software (Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel preferred)

  • Some experience with quantitative research 

  • Well-organized and professional

  • Familiarity with Salesforce a plus

How to Apply: 

Interested applicants should submit a resume and cover letter. In the cover letter, please address the following:

  • Why do you want to intern with The Bail Project?

  • Please share 1-2 experiences that highlight why you would be a strong candidate for this internship and how you meet the qualifications for the position.

No emails, faxes, or phone calls, please. Applicants will be notified regarding whether or not they have been selected for an interview. Applications without cover letters will not be processed.

Only candidates who live within a 90-minute radius of Augusta will be considered for this role.

The Bail Project is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and actively seeks the candidacy of people of color, women, LGBTQIA people, and formerly incarcerated individuals. We are committed to inclusive hiring and dedicated to diversity in our work and staff.

Note: This position should ideally be filled by an undergraduate or graduate student, someone directly or indirectly impacted by the bail system, or an individual coming from an internship-providing institution.

description:
Are you looking for a career that allows you to use your knowledge of system software engineering while working with innovative products and solutions?  Are you energetic, outgoing and willing to learn in a fast-paced environment?  If so, your future could begin at Pepperl+Fuchs, Inc!

 

A leading developer in the global automation market, Pepperl+Fuchs, Inc. is looking for a hardworking, ambitious individual to fill an immediate need for System Software Engineering Intern at our New Brighton Minnesota location.  The working hours are between 8:00 am to 5:00 pm up to 24 hours per week.  Hours can be flexible to accommodate your school schedule.  We will consider someone who can work some hours each day or someone who can work full time three days a week. 

 

Responsibilities:

 

As a System Software Engineering Intern, you will support the activities of the engineering staff:

  • Use Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs) for testing
  • Interact with Technical Support to assist with more technical customer problems
  • Interact with various engineering contacts to assist with troubleshooting and other technical needs
  • Generate / modify test plans for software products
  • Test and track the results of test tools in accordance with test plans
  • Develop automated test routines to help expedite the industrial applications test process
  • Generate official test reports for all the software products that are under test

 

Qualifications:

  • Some programming experience in C# is a plus
  • Working toward a bachelorâs degree in computer science, computer engineering or electrical engineering
  • Excellent oral and written communications skills and working knowledge of Word and Excel

If you meet the qualifications above, please apply!  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

#CB

Overview

At Tintri, we pride ourselves on challenging convention, so we hire people that choose to see old problems in new ways. The group includes technology geeks and master marketeers, but more importantly it's a collection of people who care deeply about their work. That makes for healthy debate, new ideas and unmatched learning. Our customers adore us because we've built an environment where employees can do their best work every day.  Today, more than 80% workloads are virtualized, but the storage on which those workloads depend was built for a physical world. That forces companies to contort their storage and endure unnecessary complexity. Tintri is the ONLY intelligent infrastructure provider that has architected a solution specifically for virtualized and private cloud environments. Our customers include 6 of the Fortune 15. Bet on brilliant. Learn more about the Tintri portfolio of solutions at https://www.tintri.com/products

Job Description

 

Job Title: Intern - Datacenter operations Engineer (DC-Ops Engineer) - Colorado

Responsibilities:

 

  • Deployment, configuration, and sustenance of servers, network switches/routers and storage in DC racks.
  • Schedule and perform maintenance including upgrades, migrations, and managing the production networks.
  •  
  • Coordinate with IT teams to ensure a robust and secure access environment is enabled within the data center
  • Support development, testing and integration of new and existing Server/Storage hardware platforms.
  • Support a resilient virtual infrastructure using VMWare, Kubernetes and similar technologies and be able to manage networks using Cisco and/or Juniper network devices
  • Must be willing to work outside the normal work hours (on-call) on rotation or as needed

 

Required background/skills:

 

  • Computer science, Electronics background (BS, College Diploma preferred)
    • Pursuing candidates welcome
  • Physical capability to lift, rack, stack servers into racks
  • Familiarity with the Windows, Linux and VMware based systems.
    • Must be able to work with basic troubleshooting Linux commands (top, uptime, sar, ifconfig, systemctl, grep, ls, df, du etc.)
  • Willingness to learn new/modern technology stacks (vSphere, ESX, Linux internals, Tanzu, Kubernetes, cloud (AWS))
  • Have a can-do attitude, willing to learn and grow with the evolving needs of the data center operations teams

 

Preferred (Nice to have):

 

  • College diploma or university degree; in the field of computer science preferred or 1+ years equivalent work experience
  • Working knowledge of SAS, SATA, SSD devices and Multi Host NICs.
  • Experience on Virtualization technologies (VMWare, HyperV ) a plus
  • Networking certifications (CCPA, CCNA, TCP/IP, VLAN, Subnet, Routing, OSI models)
  • Experience with field-based work in Data Centers, Colocation Facilities, Internet Exchanges, or Central Offices.
  • Public and/or private cloud experience (AWS, GCP, Azure, Open stack)
  • Experience with scripting and automation (Bash, Python, Perl)

 

Work Conditions:

  • On-call availability
  • Performs maintenance during after-hours or weekend maintenance windows
  • Work from home on occasion
  • Occasional travel

position: Intern - I&C Engineering - KK - LYH - May 2021
description:
Looking for an exciting opportunity in the nuclear industry? Grow your career at Framatome!

Framatome is a major international player in the nuclear energy market recognized for its innovative solutions and value-added technologies for designing, building, maintaining, and advancing the global nuclear fleet. The company designs, manufactures, and installs components and fuel for nuclear power plants and offers a full range of reactor services.

With 14,000 employees worldwide, every day Framatomeâs expertise helps its customers improve the safety and performance of their nuclear plants and achieve their economic and societal goals.

Join the energy conversation with Framatome Inc. on Twitter: @FramatomeUS and Facebook: @FramatomeUS.

Framatome is owned by the EDF Group (75.5%), Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (MHI 19.5%) and Assystem (5%).

JOB DESCRIPTION

Framatome is seeking an Engineering Intern to support our I&C Electrical and Instrumentation organization.

This qualified individual will:

In a team-based environment, support Engineers who design digital and analog control systems for nuclear power plants. Working alongside more senior engineers, will assist in defining system requirements, developing system logic and defining control parameters to satisfy requirements.

You will also assist in performing system integration of hardware and software platforms, as well as prepare documentation such as requirements, test procedures, and instruction manuals. You will assist senior design engineers during installation and start-up of delivered I&C systems and with hardware design for integration with software (system integration with some board level design).



Required Skills


Required Experience

All candidates must meet the following minimum requirements in order to be considered for this opportunity.

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer or Electrical Engineering/Engineering Technology, Computer Science or Physics, with at least four semesters completed by start of internship/co-op.
    • Please attach a copy of your unofficial academic transcript as part of your application. Transcripts can be added in the Profile Attachments section (Step 5) of the online application.
  • Strong academic performance
  • Strong math and computer programming coursework/experience
  • Strong technical problem-solving abilities
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to use typical laboratory equipment such as Signal Generators, Oscilloscopes, DVMs, Power Supplies, and logic analyzers
  • Completed curriculum or labs in analog and digital electronics design (for those seeking a Hardware-oriented internship)
  • Lab experience involving software and hardware integration

The following requirements are desired and will be used to differentiate all candidates who apply for this position.

  • Previous internship/co-op experience in field of study

  • Lab experience in embedded system design and programming

  • Lab experience with 2D CAD or 3D modeling software (i.e., AutoCAD, Solidworks)

  • Coursework or other experience with a high level programming language such as C++, C#, Java, Visual Basic, or LabView

  • Skills in analog & digital electronics design

  • PCB layout (Eagle)

  • PLC programming âââââ

This opportunity is in Lynchburg, Virginia

After work you will enjoy all that Central Virginia has to offer. From beautiful Smith Mountain Lake to the scenic Blue Ridge Mountains you can hike, mountain bike, snowboard and water ski to your hearts content. You'll avoid the traffic hassles of a major city, while being in driving distance to many of the major cities, beaches and attractions along the mid-Atlantic coast. Take in a minor league baseball game or one of the many festivals in the region. Our Young Generation Nuclear group hosts numerous social and professional development events that will allow you to quickly build relationships and advance your career.

Framatome is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.
